1.verse: Two Ways to Live - Happy are those who don’t listen to the wicked, who don’t go where sinners go, who don’t do what evil people do.

2.verse: They love the LORD’s teachings, and they think about those teachings day and night.

3.verse: They are strong, like a tree planted by a river. The tree produces fruit in season, and its leaves don’t die. Everything they do will succeed.

4.verse: But wicked people are not like that. They are like chaff that the wind blows away.

5.verse: So the wicked will not escape God’s punishment. Sinners will not worship with God’s people.

6.verse: This is because the LORD takes care of his people, but the wicked will be destroyed.

1.verse: The Lord’s Chosen King - Why are the nations so angry? Why are the people making useless plans?

2.verse: The kings of the earth prepare to fight, and their leaders make plans together against the LORD and his appointed one.

3.verse: They say, “Let’s break the chains that hold us back and throw off the ropes that tie us down.”

4.verse: But the one who sits in heaven laughs; the Lord makes fun of them.

5.verse: Then the LORD warns them and frightens them with his anger.

6.verse: He says, “I have appointed my own king to rule in Jerusalem on my holy mountain, Zion.”

7.verse: Now I will tell you what the LORD has declared: He said to me, “You are my son. Today I have become your father.

8.verse: If you ask me, I will give you the nations; all the people on earth will be yours.

9.verse: You will rule over them with an iron rod. You will break them into pieces like pottery.”

10.verse: So, kings, be wise; rulers, learn this lesson.

11.verse: Obey the LORD with great fear. Be happy, but tremble.

12.verse: Show that you are loyal to his son, or you will be destroyed by his anger, because he can quickly become angry. But happy are those who trust him for protection.

1.verse: A Morning Prayer - David sang this when he ran away from his son Absalom. LORD, I have many enemies! Many people have turned against me.

2.verse: Many are saying about me, “God won’t rescue him.” Selah

3.verse: But, LORD, you are my shield, my wonderful God who gives me courage.

4.verse: I will pray to the LORD, and he will answer me from his holy mountain. Selah

5.verse: I can lie down and go to sleep, and I will wake up again, because the LORD gives me strength.

6.verse: Thousands of troops may surround me, but I am not afraid.

7.verse: LORD, rise up! My God, come save me! You have struck my enemies on the cheek; you have broken the teeth of the wicked.

8.verse: The LORD can save his people. LORD, bless your people. Selah

1.verse: An Evening Prayer - For the director of music. With stringed instruments. A psalm of David. Answer me when I pray to you, my God who does what is right. Make things easier for me when I am in trouble. Have mercy on me and hear my prayer.

2.verse: People, how long will you turn my honor into shame? How long will you love what is false and look for new lies? Selah

3.verse: You know that the LORD has chosen for himself those who are loyal to him. The LORD listens when I pray to him.

4.verse: When you are angry, do not sin. Think about these things quietly as you go to bed. Selah

5.verse: Do what is right as a sacrifice to the LORD and trust the LORD.

6.verse: Many people ask, “Who will give us anything good?” LORD, be kind to us.

7.verse: But you have made me very happy, happier than they are, even with all their grain and new wine.

8.verse: I go to bed and sleep in peace, because, LORD, only you keep me safe.

1.verse: A Morning Prayer for Protection - For the director of music. For flutes. A psalm of David. LORD, listen to my words. Understand my sadness.

2.verse: Listen to my cry for help, my King and my God, because I pray to you.

3.verse: LORD, every morning you hear my voice. Every morning, I tell you what I need, and I wait for your answer.

4.verse: You are not a God who is pleased with the wicked; you do not live with those who do evil.

5.verse: Those people who make fun of you cannot stand before you. You hate all those who do evil.

6.verse: You destroy liars; the LORD hates those who kill and trick others.

7.verse: Because of your great love, I can come into your Temple. Because I fear and respect you, I can worship in your holy Temple.

8.verse: LORD, since I have many enemies, show me the right thing to do. Show me clearly how you want me to live.

9.verse: My enemies’ mouths do not tell the truth; in their hearts they want to destroy others. Their throats are like open graves; they use their tongues for telling lies.

10.verse: God, declare them guilty! Let them fall into their own traps. Send them away because their sins are many; they have turned against you.

11.verse: But let everyone who trusts you be happy; let them sing glad songs forever. Protect those who love you and who are happy because of you.

12.verse: LORD, you bless those who do what is right; you protect them like a soldier’s shield.

1.verse: A Prayer for Mercy in Troubled Times - For the director of music. With stringed instruments. Upon the sheminith. A psalm of David. LORD, don’t correct me when you are angry; don’t punish me when you are very angry.

2.verse: LORD, have mercy on me because I am weak. Heal me, LORD, because my bones ache.

3.verse: I am very upset. LORD, how long will it be?

4.verse: LORD, return and save me; save me because of your kindness.

5.verse: Dead people don’t remember you; those in the grave don’t praise you.

6.verse: I am tired of crying to you. Every night my bed is wet with tears; my bed is soaked from my crying.

7.verse: My eyes are weak from so much crying; they are weak from crying about my enemies.

8.verse: Get away from me, all you who do evil, because the LORD has heard my crying.

9.verse: The LORD has heard my cry for help; the LORD will answer my prayer.

10.verse: All my enemies will be ashamed and troubled. They will turn and suddenly leave in shame.

1.verse: A Prayer for Fairness - A shiggaion of David which he sang to the LORD about Cush, from the tribe of Benjamin. LORD my God, I trust in you for protection. Save me and rescue me from those who are chasing me.

2.verse: Otherwise, like a lion they will tear me apart. They will rip me to pieces, and no one can save me.

3.verse: LORD my God, what have I done? Have my hands done something wrong?

4.verse: Have I done wrong to my friend or stolen without reason from my enemy?

5.verse: If I have, let my enemy chase me and capture me. Let him trample me into the dust and bury me in the ground. Selah

6.verse: LORD, rise up in your anger; stand up against my enemies’ anger. Get up and demand fairness.

7.verse: Gather the nations around you and rule them from above.

8.verse: LORD, judge the people. LORD, defend me because I am right, because I have done no wrong, God Most High.

9.verse: God, you do what is right. You know our thoughts and feelings. Stop those wicked actions done by evil people, and help those who do what is right.

10.verse: God protects me like a shield; he saves those whose hearts are right.

11.verse: God judges by what is right, and God is always ready to punish the wicked.

12.verse: If they do not change their lives, God will sharpen his sword; he will string his bow and take aim.

13.verse: He has prepared his deadly weapons; he has made his flaming arrows.

14.verse: There are people who think up evil and plan trouble and tell lies.

15.verse: They dig a hole to trap others, but they will fall into it themselves.

16.verse: They will get themselves into trouble; the violence they cause will hurt only themselves.

17.verse: I praise the LORD because he does what is right. I sing praises to the LORD Most High.

1.verse: The Lord’s Greatness - For the director of music. On the gittith. A psalm of David. LORD our Lord, your name is the most wonderful name in all the earth! It brings you praise in heaven above.

2.verse: You have taught children and babies to sing praises to you because of your enemies. And so you silence your enemies and destroy those who try to get even.

3.verse: I look at your heavens, which you made with your fingers. I see the moon and stars, which you created.

4.verse: But why are people even important to you? Why do you take care of human beings?

5.verse: You made them a little lower than the angels and crowned them with glory and honor.

6.verse: You put them in charge of everything you made. You put all things under their control:

7.verse: all the sheep, the cattle, and the wild animals,

8.verse: the birds in the sky, the fish in the sea, and everything that lives under water.

9.verse: LORD our Lord, your name is the most wonderful name in all the earth!

1.verse: Thanksgiving for Victory - For the director of music. To the tune of “The Death of the Son.” A psalm of David. I will praise you, LORD, with all my heart. I will tell all the miracles you have done.

2.verse: I will be happy because of you; God Most High, I will sing praises to your name.

3.verse: My enemies turn back; they are overwhelmed and die because of you.

4.verse: You have heard my complaint; you sat on your throne and judged by what was right.

5.verse: You spoke strongly against the foreign nations and destroyed the wicked; you wiped out their names forever and ever.

6.verse: The enemy is gone forever. You destroyed their cities; no one even remembers them.

7.verse: But the LORD rules forever. He sits on his throne to judge,

8.verse: and he will judge the world in fairness; he will decide what is fair for the nations.

9.verse: The LORD defends those who suffer; he defends them in times of trouble.

10.verse: Those who know the LORD trust him, because he will not leave those who come to him.

11.verse: Sing praises to the LORD who is king on Mount Zion. Tell the nations what he has done.

12.verse: He remembers who the murderers are; he will not forget the cries of those who suffer.

13.verse: LORD, have mercy on me. See how my enemies hurt me. Do not let me go through the gates of death.

14.verse: Then, at the gates of Jerusalem, I will praise you; I will rejoice because you saved me.

15.verse: The nations have fallen into the pit they dug. Their feet are caught in the nets they laid.

16.verse: The LORD has made himself known by his fair decisions; the wicked get trapped by what they do. Higgaion. Selah

17.verse: Wicked people will go to the grave, and so will all those who forget God.

18.verse: But those who have troubles will not be forgotten. The hopes of the poor will never die.

19.verse: LORD, rise up and judge the nations. Don’t let people think they are strong.

20.verse: Teach them to fear you, LORD. The nations must learn that they are only human. Selah

1.verse: A Complaint About Evil People - LORD, why are you so far away? Why do you hide when there is trouble?

2.verse: Proudly the wicked chase down those who suffer. Let them be caught in their own traps.

3.verse: They brag about the things they want. They bless the greedy but hate the LORD.

4.verse: The wicked people are too proud. They do not look for God; there is no room for God in their thoughts.

5.verse: They always succeed. They are far from keeping your laws; they make fun of their enemies.

6.verse: They say to themselves, “Nothing bad will ever happen to me; I will never be ruined.”

7.verse: Their mouths are full of curses, lies, and threats; they use their tongues for sin and evil.

8.verse: They hide near the villages. They look for innocent people to kill; they watch in secret for the helpless.

9.verse: They wait in hiding like a lion. They wait to catch poor people; they catch the poor in nets.

10.verse: The poor are thrown down and crushed; they are defeated because the others are stronger.

11.verse: The wicked think, “God has forgotten us. He doesn’t see what is happening.”

12.verse: LORD, rise up and punish the wicked. Don’t forget those who need help.

13.verse: Why do wicked people hate God? They say to themselves, “God won’t punish us.”

14.verse: LORD, surely you see these cruel and evil things; look at them and do something. People in trouble look to you for help. You are the one who helps the orphans.

15.verse: Break the power of wicked people. Punish them for the evil they have done.

16.verse: The LORD is King forever and ever. Destroy from your land those nations that do not worship you.

17.verse: LORD, you have heard what the poor people want. Do what they ask, and listen to them.

18.verse: Protect the orphans and put an end to suffering so they will no longer be afraid of evil people.

1.verse: Trust in the LORD - For the director of music. Of David. I trust in the LORD for protection. So why do you say to me, “Fly like a bird to your mountain.

2.verse: Like hunters, the wicked string their bows; they set their arrows on the bowstrings. They shoot from dark places at those who are honest.

3.verse: When the foundations for good collapse, what can good people do?”

4.verse: The LORD is in his holy temple; the LORD sits on his throne in heaven. He sees what people do; he keeps his eye on them.

5.verse: The LORD tests those who do right, but he hates the wicked and those who love to hurt others.

6.verse: He will send hot coals and burning sulfur on the wicked. A whirlwind is what they will get.

7.verse: The LORD does what is right, and he loves justice, so honest people will see his face.

1.verse: A Prayer Against Liars - For the director of music. Upon the sheminith. A psalm of David. Save me, LORD, because the good people are all gone; no true believers are left on earth.

2.verse: Everyone lies to his neighbors; they say one thing and mean another.

3.verse: The LORD will stop those flattering lips and cut off those bragging tongues.

4.verse: They say, “Our tongues will help us win. We can say what we wish; no one is our master.”

5.verse: But the LORD says, “I will now rise up, because the poor are being hurt. Because of the moans of the helpless, I will give them the help they want.”

6.verse: The LORD’s words are pure, like silver purified by fire, like silver purified seven times over.

7.verse: LORD, you will keep us safe; you will always protect us from such people.

8.verse: But the wicked are all around us; everyone loves what is wrong.

1.verse: A Prayer for God to Be Near - For the director of music. A psalm of David. How long will you forget me, LORD? Forever? How long will you hide from me?

2.verse: How long must I worry and feel sad in my heart all day? How long will my enemy win over me?

3.verse: LORD, look at me. Answer me, my God; tell me, or I will die.

4.verse: Otherwise my enemy will say, “I have won!” Those against me will rejoice that I’ve been defeated.

5.verse: I trust in your love. My heart is happy because you saved me.

6.verse: I sing to the LORD because he has taken care of me.

1.verse: The Unbelieving Fool - For the director of music. Of David. Fools say to themselves, “There is no God.” Fools are evil and do terrible things; there is no one who does anything good.

2.verse: The LORD looked down from heaven on all people to see if anyone understood, if anyone was looking to God for help.

3.verse: But all have turned away. Together, everyone has become evil. There is no one who does anything good, not even one.

4.verse: Don’t the wicked understand? They destroy my people as if they were eating bread. They do not ask the LORD for help.

5.verse: But the wicked are filled with terror, because God is with those who do what is right.

6.verse: The wicked upset the plans of the poor, but the LORD will protect them.

7.verse: I pray that victory will come to Israel from Mount Zion! May the LORD bring them back. Then the people of Jacob will rejoice, and the people of Israel will be glad.

1.verse: What the Lord Demands - A psalm of David. LORD, who may enter your Holy Tent? Who may live on your holy mountain?

2.verse: Only those who are innocent and who do what is right. Such people speak the truth from their hearts

3.verse: and do not tell lies about others. They do no wrong to their neighbors and do not gossip.

4.verse: They do not respect hateful people but honor those who honor the LORD. They keep their promises to their neighbors, even when it hurts.

5.verse: They do not charge interest on money they lend and do not take money to hurt innocent people. Whoever does all these things will never be destroyed.

1.verse: The Lord Takes Care of His People - A miktam of David. Protect me, God, because I trust in you.

2.verse: I said to the LORD, “You are my Lord. Every good thing I have comes from you.”

3.verse: As for the godly people in the world, they are the wonderful ones I enjoy.

4.verse: But those who turn to idols will have much pain. I will not offer blood to those idols or even speak their names.

5.verse: No, the LORD is all I need. He takes care of me.

6.verse: My share in life has been pleasant; my part has been beautiful.

7.verse: I praise the LORD because he advises me. Even at night, I feel his leading.

8.verse: I keep the LORD before me always. Because he is close by my side, I will not be hurt.

9.verse: So I rejoice and am glad. Even my body has hope,

10.verse: because you will not leave me in the grave. You will not let your holy one rot.

11.verse: You will teach me how to live a holy life. Being with you will fill me with joy; at your right hand I will find pleasure forever.

1.verse: A Prayer for Protection - A prayer of David. LORD, hear me begging for fairness; listen to my cry for help. Pay attention to my prayer, because I speak the truth.

2.verse: You will judge that I am right; your eyes can see what is true.

3.verse: You have examined my heart; you have tested me all night. You questioned me without finding anything wrong; I have not sinned with my mouth.

4.verse: I have obeyed your commands, so I have not done what evil people do.

5.verse: I have done what you told me; I have not failed.

6.verse: I call to you, God, and you answer me. Listen to me now, and hear what I say.

7.verse: Your love is wonderful. By your power you save those who trust you from their enemies.

8.verse: Protect me as you would protect your own eye. Hide me under the shadow of your wings.

9.verse: Keep me from the wicked who attack me, from my enemies who surround me.

10.verse: They are selfish and brag about themselves.

11.verse: They have chased me until they have surrounded me. They plan to throw me to the ground.

12.verse: They are like lions ready to kill; like lions, they sit in hiding.

13.verse: LORD, rise up, face the enemy, and throw them down. Save me from the wicked with your sword.

14.verse: LORD, save me by your power from those whose reward is in this life. They have plenty of food. They have many sons and leave much money to their children.

15.verse: Because I have lived right, I will see your face. When I wake up, I will see your likeness and be satisfied.

1.verse: A Song of Victory - For the director of music. By the LORD’s servant, David. David sang this song to the LORD when the LORD had saved him from Saul and all his other enemies. I love you, LORD. You are my strength.

2.verse: The LORD is my rock, my protection, my Savior. My God is my rock. I can run to him for safety. He is my shield and my saving strength, my defender.

3.verse: I will call to the LORD, who is worthy of praise, and I will be saved from my enemies.

4.verse: The ropes of death came around me; the deadly rivers overwhelmed me.

5.verse: The ropes of death wrapped around me. The traps of death were before me.

6.verse: In my trouble I called to the LORD. I cried out to my God for help. From his temple he heard my voice; my call for help reached his ears.

7.verse: The earth trembled and shook. The foundations of the mountains began to shake. They trembled because the LORD was angry.

8.verse: Smoke came out of his nose, and burning fire came out of his mouth. Burning coals went before him.

9.verse: He tore open the sky and came down with dark clouds under his feet.

10.verse: He rode a creature with wings and flew. He raced on the wings of the wind.

11.verse: He made darkness his covering, his shelter around him, surrounded by fog and clouds.

12.verse: Out of the brightness of his presence came clouds with hail and lightning.

13.verse: The LORD thundered from heaven; the Most High raised his voice, and there was hail and lightning.

14.verse: He shot his arrows and scattered his enemies. His many bolts of lightning confused them with fear.

15.verse: LORD, you spoke strongly. The wind blew from your nose. Then the valleys of the sea appeared, and the foundations of the earth were seen.

16.verse: The LORD reached down from above and took me; he pulled me from the deep water.

17.verse: He saved me from my powerful enemies, from those who hated me, because they were too strong for me.

18.verse: They attacked me at my time of trouble, but the LORD supported me.

19.verse: He took me to a safe place. Because he delights in me, he saved me.

20.verse: The LORD spared me because I did what was right. Because I have not done evil, he has rewarded me.

21.verse: I have followed the ways of the LORD; I have not done evil by turning away from my God.

22.verse: I remember all his laws and have not broken his rules.

23.verse: I am innocent before him; I have kept myself from doing evil.

24.verse: The LORD rewarded me because I did what was right, because I did what the LORD said was right.

25.verse: LORD, you are loyal to those who are loyal, and you are good to those who are good.

26.verse: You are pure to those who are pure, but you are against those who are bad.

27.verse: You save the humble, but you bring down those who are proud.

28.verse: LORD, you give light to my lamp. My God brightens the darkness around me.

29.verse: With your help I can attack an army. With God’s help I can jump over a wall.

30.verse: The ways of God are without fault. The LORD’s words are pure. He is a shield to those who trust him.

31.verse: Who is God? Only the LORD. Who is the Rock? Only our God.

32.verse: God is my protection. He makes my way free from fault.

33.verse: He makes me like a deer that does not stumble; he helps me stand on the steep mountains.

34.verse: He trains my hands for battle so my arms can bend a bronze bow.

35.verse: You protect me with your saving shield. You support me with your right hand. You have stooped to make me great.

36.verse: You give me a better way to live, so I live as you want me to.

37.verse: I chased my enemies and caught them. I did not quit until they were destroyed.

38.verse: I crushed them so they couldn’t rise up again. They fell beneath my feet.

39.verse: You gave me strength in battle. You made my enemies bow before me.

40.verse: You made my enemies turn back, and I destroyed those who hated me.

41.verse: They called for help, but no one came to save them. They called to the LORD, but he did not answer them.

42.verse: I beat my enemies into pieces, like dust in the wind. I poured them out like mud in the streets.

43.verse: You saved me when the people attacked me. You made me the leader of nations. People I never knew serve me.

44.verse: As soon as they hear me, they obey me. Foreigners obey me.

45.verse: They all become afraid and tremble in their hiding places.

46.verse: The LORD lives! May my Rock be praised. Praise the God who saves me!

47.verse: God gives me victory over my enemies and brings people under my rule.

48.verse: He saves me from my enemies. You set me over those who hate me. You saved me from violent people.

49.verse: So I will praise you, LORD, among the nations. I will sing praises to your name.

50.verse: The LORD gives great victories to his king. He is loyal to his appointed king, to David and his descendants forever.

1.verse: God’s Works and Word - For the director of music. A psalm of David. The heavens declare the glory of God, and the skies announce what his hands have made.

2.verse: Day after day they tell the story; night after night they tell it again.

3.verse: They have no speech or words; they have no voice to be heard.

4.verse: But their message goes out through all the world; their words go everywhere on earth. The sky is like a home for the sun.

5.verse: The sun comes out like a bridegroom from his bedroom. It rejoices like an athlete eager to run a race.

6.verse: The sun rises at one end of the sky and follows its path to the other end. Nothing hides from its heat.

7.verse: The teachings of the LORD are perfect; they give new strength. The rules of the LORD can be trusted; they make plain people wise.

8.verse: The orders of the LORD are right; they make people happy. The commands of the LORD are pure; they light up the way.

9.verse: Respect for the LORD is good; it will last forever. The judgments of the LORD are true; they are completely right.

10.verse: They are worth more than gold, even the purest gold. They are sweeter than honey, even the finest honey.

11.verse: By them your servant is warned. Keeping them brings great reward.

12.verse: People cannot see their own mistakes. Forgive me for my secret sins.

13.verse: Keep me from the sins of pride; don’t let them rule me. Then I can be pure and innocent of the greatest of sins.

14.verse: I hope my words and thoughts please you. LORD, you are my Rock, the one who saves me.

1.verse: A Prayer for the King - For the director of music. A psalm of David. May the LORD answer you in times of trouble. May the God of Jacob protect you.

2.verse: May he send you help from his Temple and support you from Mount Zion.

3.verse: May he remember all your offerings and accept all your sacrifices. Selah

4.verse: May he give you what you want and make all your plans succeed,

5.verse: and we will shout for joy when you succeed, and we will raise a flag in the name of our God. May the LORD give you all that you ask for.

6.verse: Now I know the LORD helps his appointed king. He answers him from his holy heaven and saves him with his strong right hand.

7.verse: Some trust in chariots, others in horses, but we trust the LORD our God.

8.verse: They are overwhelmed and defeated, but we march forward and win.

9.verse: LORD, save the king! Answer us when we call for help.

1.verse: Thanksgiving for the King - For the director of music. A psalm of David. LORD, the king rejoices because of your strength; he is so happy when you save him!

2.verse: You gave the king what he wanted and did not refuse what he asked for. Selah

3.verse: You put good things before him and placed a gold crown on his head.

4.verse: He asked you for life, and you gave it to him, so his years go on and on.

5.verse: He has great glory because you gave him victories; you gave him honor and praise.

6.verse: You always gave him blessings; you made him glad because you were with him.

7.verse: The king truly trusts the LORD. Because God Most High always loves him, he will not be overwhelmed.

8.verse: Your hand is against all your enemies; those who hate you will feel your power.

9.verse: When you appear, you will burn them as in a furnace. In your anger you will swallow them up, and fire will burn them up.

10.verse: You will destroy their families from the earth; their children will not live.

11.verse: They made evil plans against you, but their traps won’t work.

12.verse: You will make them turn their backs when you aim your arrows at them.

13.verse: Be supreme, LORD, in your power. We sing and praise your greatness.

1.verse: The Prayer of a Suffering Man - For the director of music. To the tune of “The Doe of Dawn.” A psalm of David. My God, my God, why have you abandoned me? You seem far from saving me, far away from my groans.

2.verse: My God, I call to you during the day, but you do not answer. I call at night; I am not silent.

3.verse: You sit as the Holy One. The praises of Israel are your throne.

4.verse: Our ancestors trusted you; they trusted, and you saved them.

5.verse: They called to you for help and were rescued. They trusted you and were not disappointed.

6.verse: But I am like a worm instead of a man. People make fun of me and hate me.

7.verse: Those who look at me laugh. They stick out their tongues and shake their heads.

8.verse: They say, “Turn to the LORD for help. Maybe he will save you. If he likes you, maybe he will rescue you.”

9.verse: You had my mother give birth to me. You made me trust you while I was just a baby.

10.verse: I have leaned on you since the day I was born; you have been my God since my mother gave me birth.

11.verse: So don’t be far away from me. Now trouble is near, and there is no one to help.

12.verse: People have surrounded me like angry bulls. Like the strong bulls of Bashan, they are on every side.

13.verse: Like hungry, roaring lions they open their mouths at me.

14.verse: My strength is gone, like water poured out onto the ground, and my bones are out of joint. My heart is like wax; it has melted inside me.

15.verse: My strength has dried up like a clay pot, and my tongue sticks to the top of my mouth. You laid me in the dust of death.

16.verse: Evil people have surrounded me; like dogs they have trapped me. They have bitten my arms and legs.

17.verse: I can count all my bones; people look and stare at me.

18.verse: They divided my clothes among them, and they threw lots for my clothing.

19.verse: But, LORD, don’t be far away. You are my strength; hurry to help me.

20.verse: Save me from the sword; save my life from the dogs.

21.verse: Rescue me from the lion’s mouth; save me from the horns of the bulls.

22.verse: Then I will tell my brothers and sisters about you; I will praise you in the public meeting.

23.verse: Praise the LORD, all you who respect him. All you descendants of Jacob, honor him; fear him, all you Israelites.

24.verse: He does not ignore those in trouble. He doesn’t hide from them but listens when they call out to him.

25.verse: LORD, I praise you in the great meeting of your people; these worshipers will see me do what I promised.

26.verse: Poor people will eat until they are full; those who look to the LORD will praise him. May your hearts live forever!

27.verse: People everywhere will remember and will turn to the LORD. All the families of the nations will worship him

28.verse: because the LORD is King, and he rules the nations.

29.verse: All the powerful people on earth will eat and worship. Everyone will bow down to him, all who will one day die.

30.verse: The people in the future will serve him; they will always be told about the Lord.

31.verse: They will tell that he does what is right. People who are not yet born will hear what God has done.

1.verse: The Lord the Shepherd - A psalm of David. The LORD is my shepherd; I have everything I need.

2.verse: He lets me rest in green pastures. He leads me to calm water.

3.verse: He gives me new strength. He leads me on paths that are right for the good of his name.

4.verse: Even if I walk through a very dark valley, I will not be afraid, because you are with me. Your rod and your shepherd’s staff comfort me.

5.verse: You prepare a meal for me in front of my enemies. You pour oil of blessing on my head; you fill my cup to overflowing.

6.verse: Surely your goodness and love will be with me all my life, and I will live in the house of the LORD forever.

1.verse: A Welcome for God into the Temple - A psalm of David. The earth belongs to the LORD, and everything in it— the world and all its people.

2.verse: He built it on the waters and set it on the rivers.

3.verse: Who may go up on the mountain of the LORD? Who may stand in his holy Temple?

4.verse: Only those with clean hands and pure hearts, who have not worshiped idols, who have not made promises in the name of a false god.

5.verse: They will receive a blessing from the LORD; the God who saves them will declare them right.

6.verse: They try to follow God; they look to the God of Jacob for help. Selah

7.verse: Open up, you gates. Open wide, you aged doors and the glorious King will come in.

8.verse: Who is this glorious King? The LORD, strong and mighty. The LORD, the powerful warrior.

9.verse: Open up, you gates. Open wide, you aged doors and the glorious King will come in.

10.verse: Who is this glorious King? The LORD All-Powerful— he is the glorious King. Selah

1.verse: A Prayer for God to Guide - Of David. LORD, I give myself to you;

2.verse: my God, I trust you. Do not let me be disgraced; do not let my enemies laugh at me.

3.verse: No one who trusts you will be disgraced, but those who sin without excuse will be disgraced.

4.verse: LORD, tell me your ways. Show me how to live.

5.verse: Guide me in your truth, and teach me, my God, my Savior. I trust you all day long.

6.verse: LORD, remember your mercy and love that you have shown since long ago.

7.verse: Do not remember the sins and wrong things I did when I was young. But remember to love me always because you are good, LORD.

8.verse: The LORD is good and right; he points sinners to the right way.

9.verse: He shows those who are humble how to do right, and he teaches them his ways.

10.verse: All the LORD’s ways are loving and true for those who follow the demands of his agreement.

11.verse: For the sake of your name, LORD, forgive my many sins.

12.verse: Are there those who respect the LORD? He will point them to the best way.

13.verse: They will enjoy a good life, and their children will inherit the land.

14.verse: The LORD tells his secrets to those who respect him; he tells them about his agreement.

15.verse: My eyes are always looking to the LORD for help. He will keep me from any traps.

16.verse: Turn to me and have mercy on me, because I am lonely and hurting.

17.verse: My troubles have grown larger; free me from my problems.

18.verse: Look at my suffering and troubles, and take away all my sins.

19.verse: Look at how many enemies I have! See how much they hate me!

20.verse: Protect me and save me. I trust you, so do not let me be disgraced.

21.verse: My hope is in you, so may goodness and honesty guard me.

22.verse: God, save Israel from all their troubles!

1.verse: The Prayer of an Innocent Believer - Of David. LORD, defend me because I have lived an innocent life. I have trusted the LORD and never doubted.

2.verse: LORD, try me and test me; look closely into my heart and mind.

3.verse: I see your love, and I live by your truth.

4.verse: I do not spend time with liars, nor do I make friends with those who hide their sin.

5.verse: I hate the company of evil people, and I won’t sit with the wicked.

6.verse: I wash my hands to show I am innocent, and I come to your altar, LORD.

7.verse: I raise my voice in praise and tell of all the miracles you have done.

8.verse: LORD, I love the Temple where you live, where your glory is.

9.verse: Do not kill me with those sinners or take my life with those murderers.

10.verse: Evil is in their hands, and they do wrong for money.

11.verse: But I have lived an innocent life, so save me and have mercy on me.

12.verse: I stand in a safe place. LORD, I praise you in the great meeting.

1.verse: A Song of Trust in God - Of David. The LORD is my light and the one who saves me. So why should I fear anyone? The LORD protects my life. So why should I be afraid?

2.verse: Evil people may try to destroy my body. My enemies and those who hate me attack me, but they are overwhelmed and defeated.

3.verse: If an army surrounds me, I will not be afraid. If war breaks out, I will trust the LORD.

4.verse: I ask only one thing from the LORD. This is what I want: Let me live in the LORD’s house all my life. Let me see the LORD’s beauty and look with my own eyes at his Temple.

5.verse: During danger he will keep me safe in his shelter. He will hide me in his Holy Tent, or he will keep me safe on a high mountain.

6.verse: My head is higher than my enemies around me. I will offer joyful sacrifices in his Holy Tent. I will sing and praise the LORD.

7.verse: LORD, hear me when I call; have mercy and answer me.

8.verse: My heart said of you, “Go, worship him.” So I come to worship you, LORD.

9.verse: Do not turn away from me. Do not turn your servant away in anger; you have helped me. Do not push me away or leave me alone, God, my Savior.

10.verse: If my father and mother leave me, the LORD will take me in.

11.verse: LORD, teach me your ways, and guide me to do what is right because I have enemies.

12.verse: Do not hand me over to my enemies, because they tell lies about me and say they will hurt me.

13.verse: I truly believe I will live to see the LORD’s goodness.

14.verse: Wait for the LORD’s help. Be strong and brave, and wait for the LORD’s help.

1.verse: A Prayer in Troubled Times - Of David. LORD, my Rock, I call out to you for help. Do not be deaf to me. If you are silent, I will be like those in the grave.

2.verse: Hear the sound of my prayer, when I cry out to you for help. I raise my hands toward your Most Holy Place.

3.verse: Don’t drag me away with the wicked, with those who do evil. They say “Peace” to their neighbors, but evil is in their hearts.

4.verse: Pay them back for what they have done, for their evil deeds. Pay them back for what they have done; give them their reward.

5.verse: They don’t understand what the LORD has done or what he has made. So he will knock them down and not lift them up.

6.verse: Praise the LORD, because he heard my prayer for help.

7.verse: The LORD is my strength and shield. I trust him, and he helps me. I am very happy, and I praise him with my song.

8.verse: The LORD is powerful; he gives victory to his chosen one.

9.verse: Save your people and bless those who are your own. Be their shepherd and carry them forever.

1.verse: God in the Thunderstorm - A psalm of David. Praise the LORD, you angels; praise the LORD’s glory and power.

2.verse: Praise the LORD for the glory of his name; worship the LORD because he is holy.

3.verse: The LORD’s voice is heard over the sea. The glorious God thunders; the LORD thunders over the ocean.

4.verse: The LORD’s voice is powerful; the LORD’s voice is majestic.

5.verse: The LORD’s voice breaks the trees; the LORD breaks the cedars of Lebanon.

6.verse: He makes the land of Lebanon dance like a calf and Mount Hermon jump like a baby bull.

7.verse: The LORD’s voice makes the lightning flash.

8.verse: The LORD’s voice shakes the desert; the LORD shakes the Desert of Kadesh.

9.verse: The LORD’s voice shakes the oaks and strips the leaves off the trees. In his Temple everyone says, “Glory to God!”

10.verse: The LORD controls the flood. The LORD will be King forever.

11.verse: The LORD gives strength to his people; the LORD blesses his people with peace.

1.verse: Thanksgiving for Escaping Death - A psalm of David. A song for giving the Temple to the LORD. I will praise you, LORD, because you rescued me. You did not let my enemies laugh at me.

2.verse: LORD, my God, I prayed to you, and you healed me.

3.verse: You lifted me out of the grave; you spared me from going down to the place of the dead.

4.verse: Sing praises to the LORD, you who belong to him; praise his holy name.

5.verse: His anger lasts only a moment, but his kindness lasts for a lifetime. Crying may last for a night, but joy comes in the morning.

6.verse: When I felt safe, I said, “I will never fear.”

7.verse: LORD, in your kindness you made my mountain safe. But when you turned away, I was frightened.

8.verse: I called to you, LORD, and asked you to have mercy on me.

9.verse: I said, “What good will it do if I die or if I go down to the grave? Dust cannot praise you; it cannot speak about your truth.

10.verse: LORD, hear me and have mercy on me. LORD, help me.”

11.verse: You changed my sorrow into dancing. You took away my clothes of sadness, and clothed me in happiness.

12.verse: I will sing to you and not be silent. LORD, my God, I will praise you forever.

1.verse: A Prayer of Faith in Troubled Times - For the director of music. A psalm of David. LORD, I trust in you; let me never be disgraced. Save me because you do what is right.

2.verse: Listen to me and save me quickly. Be my rock of protection, a strong city to save me.

3.verse: You are my rock and my protection. For the good of your name, lead me and guide me.

4.verse: Set me free from the trap they set for me, because you are my protection.

5.verse: I give you my life. Save me, LORD, God of truth.

6.verse: I hate those who worship false gods. I trust only in the LORD.

7.verse: I will be glad and rejoice in your love, because you saw my suffering; you knew my troubles.

8.verse: You have not handed me over to my enemies but have set me in a safe place.

9.verse: LORD, have mercy, because I am in misery. My eyes are weak from so much crying, and my whole being is tired from grief.

10.verse: My life is ending in sadness, and my years are spent in crying. My troubles are using up my strength, and my bones are getting weaker.

11.verse: Because of all my troubles, my enemies hate me, and even my neighbors look down on me. When my friends see me, they are afraid and run.

12.verse: I am like a piece of a broken pot. I am forgotten as if I were dead.

13.verse: I have heard many insults. Terror is all around me. They make plans against me and want to kill me.

14.verse: LORD, I trust you. I have said, “You are my God.”

15.verse: My life is in your hands. Save me from my enemies and from those who are chasing me.

16.verse: Show your kindness to me, your servant. Save me because of your love.

17.verse: LORD, I called to you, so do not let me be disgraced. Let the wicked be disgraced and lie silent in the grave.

18.verse: With pride and hatred they speak against those who do right. So silence their lying lips.

19.verse: How great is your goodness that you have stored up for those who fear you, that you have given to those who trust you. You do this for all to see.

20.verse: You protect them by your presence from what people plan against them. You shelter them from evil words.

21.verse: Praise the LORD. His love to me was wonderful when my city was attacked.

22.verse: In my distress, I said, “God cannot see me!” But you heard my prayer when I cried out to you for help.

23.verse: Love the LORD, all you who belong to him. The LORD protects those who truly believe, but he punishes the proud as much as they have sinned.

24.verse: All you who put your hope in the LORD be strong and brave.

1.verse: It Is Better to Confess Sin - A maskil of David. Happy is the person whose sins are forgiven, whose wrongs are pardoned.

2.verse: Happy is the person whom the LORD does not consider guilty and in whom there is nothing false.

3.verse: When I kept things to myself, I felt weak deep inside me. I moaned all day long.

4.verse: Day and night you punished me. My strength was gone as in the summer heat. Selah

5.verse: Then I confessed my sins to you and didn’t hide my guilt. I said, “I will confess my sins to the LORD,” and you forgave my guilt. Selah

6.verse: For this reason, all who obey you should pray to you while they still can. When troubles rise like a flood, they will not reach them.

7.verse: You are my hiding place. You protect me from my troubles and fill me with songs of salvation. Selah

8.verse: The LORD says, “I will make you wise and show you where to go. I will guide you and watch over you.

9.verse: So don’t be like a horse or donkey, that doesn’t understand. They must be led with bits and reins, or they will not come near you.”

10.verse: Wicked people have many troubles, but the LORD’s love surrounds those who trust him.

11.verse: Good people, rejoice and be happy in the LORD. Sing all you whose hearts are right.

1.verse: Praise God Who Creates and Saves - Sing to the LORD, you who do what is right; honest people should praise him.

2.verse: Praise the LORD on the harp; make music for him on a ten-stringed lyre.

3.verse: Sing a new song to him; play well and joyfully.

4.verse: God’s word is true, and everything he does is right.

5.verse: He loves what is right and fair; the LORD’s love fills the earth.

6.verse: The sky was made at the LORD’s command. By the breath from his mouth, he made all the stars.

7.verse: He gathered the water of the sea into a heap. He made the great ocean stay in its place.

8.verse: All the earth should worship the LORD; the whole world should fear him.

9.verse: He spoke, and it happened. He commanded, and it appeared.

10.verse: The LORD upsets the plans of nations; he ruins all their plans.

11.verse: But the LORD’s plans will stand forever; his ideas will last from now on.

12.verse: Happy is the nation whose God is the LORD, the people he chose for his very own.

13.verse: The LORD looks down from heaven and sees every person.

14.verse: From his throne he watches all who live on earth.

15.verse: He made their hearts and understands everything they do.

16.verse: No king is saved by his great army. No warrior escapes by his great strength.

17.verse: Horses can’t bring victory; they can’t save by their strength.

18.verse: But the LORD looks after those who fear him, those who put their hope in his love.

19.verse: He saves them from death and spares their lives in times of hunger.

20.verse: So our hope is in the LORD. He is our help, our shield to protect us.

21.verse: We rejoice in him, because we trust his holy name.

22.verse: LORD, show your love to us as we put our hope in you.

1.verse: Praise God Who Judges and Saves - David’s song from the time he acted crazy so Abimelech would send him away, and David did leave. I will praise the LORD at all times; his praise is always on my lips.

2.verse: My whole being praises the LORD. The poor will hear and be glad.

3.verse: Glorify the LORD with me, and let us praise his name together.

4.verse: I asked the LORD for help, and he answered me. He saved me from all that I feared.

5.verse: Those who go to him for help are happy, and they are never disgraced.

6.verse: This poor man called, and the LORD heard him and saved him from all his troubles.

7.verse: The angel of the LORD camps around those who fear God, and he saves them.

8.verse: Examine and see how good the LORD is. Happy is the person who trusts him.

9.verse: You who belong to the LORD, fear him! Those who fear him will have everything they need.

10.verse: Even lions may get weak and hungry, but those who look to the LORD will have every good thing.

11.verse: Children, come and listen to me. I will teach you to worship the LORD.

12.verse: You must do these things to enjoy life and have many happy days.

13.verse: You must not say evil things, and you must not tell lies.

14.verse: Stop doing evil and do good. Look for peace and work for it.

15.verse: The LORD sees the good people and listens to their prayers.

16.verse: But the LORD is against those who do evil; he makes the world forget them.

17.verse: The LORD hears good people when they cry out to him, and he saves them from all their troubles.

18.verse: The LORD is close to the brokenhearted, and he saves those whose spirits have been crushed.

19.verse: People who do what is right may have many problems, but the LORD will solve them all.

20.verse: He will protect their very bones; not one of them will be broken.

21.verse: Evil will kill the wicked; those who hate good people will be judged guilty.

22.verse: But the LORD saves his servants’ lives; no one who trusts him will be judged guilty.

1.verse: A Prayer for Help - Of David. LORD, battle with those who battle with me. Fight against those who fight against me.

2.verse: Pick up the shield and armor. Rise up and help me.

3.verse: Lift up your spears, both large and small, against those who chase me. Tell me, “I will save you.”

4.verse: Make those who want to kill me be ashamed and disgraced. Make those who plan to harm me turn back and run away.

5.verse: Make them like chaff blown by the wind as the angel of the LORD forces them away.

6.verse: Let their road be dark and slippery as the angel of the LORD chases them.

7.verse: For no reason they spread out their net to trap me; for no reason they dug a pit for me.

8.verse: So let ruin strike them suddenly. Let them be caught in their own nets; let them fall into the pit and die.

9.verse: Then I will rejoice in the LORD; I will be happy when he saves me.

10.verse: Even my bones will say, “LORD, who is like you? You save the weak from the strong, the weak and poor from robbers.”

11.verse: Men without mercy stand up to testify. They ask me things I do not know.

12.verse: They repay me with evil for the good I have done, and they make me very sad.

13.verse: Yet when they were sick, I put on clothes of sadness and showed my sorrow by fasting. But my prayers were not answered.

14.verse: I acted as if they were my friends or brothers. I bowed in sadness as if I were crying for my mother.

15.verse: But when I was in trouble, they gathered and laughed; they gathered to attack before I knew it. They insulted me without stopping.

16.verse: They made fun of me and were cruel to me and ground their teeth at me in anger.

17.verse: Lord, how long will you watch this happen? Save my life from their attacks; save me from these people who are like lions.

18.verse: I will praise you in the great meeting. I will praise you among crowds of people.

19.verse: Do not let my enemies laugh at me; they hate me for no reason. Do not let them make fun of me; they have no cause to hate me.

20.verse: Their words are not friendly but are lies about peace-loving people.

21.verse: They speak against me and say, “Aha! We saw what you did!”

22.verse: LORD, you have been watching. Do not keep quiet. Lord, do not leave me alone.

23.verse: Wake up! Come and defend me! My God and Lord, fight for me!

24.verse: LORD my God, defend me with your justice. Don’t let them laugh at me.

25.verse: Don’t let them think, “Aha! We got what we wanted!” Don’t let them say, “We destroyed him.”

26.verse: Let them be ashamed and embarrassed, because they were happy when I hurt. Cover them with shame and disgrace, because they thought they were better than I was.

27.verse: May my friends sing and shout for joy. May they always say, “Praise the greatness of the LORD, who loves to see his servants do well.”

28.verse: I will tell of your goodness and will praise you every day.

1.verse: Wicked People and a Good God - For the director of music. Of David, the servant of the LORD. Sin speaks to the wicked in their hearts. They have no fear of God.

2.verse: They think too much of themselves so they don’t see their sin and hate it.

3.verse: Their words are wicked lies; they are no longer wise or good.

4.verse: At night they make evil plans; what they do leads to nothing good. They don’t refuse things that are evil.

5.verse: LORD, your love reaches to the heavens, your loyalty to the skies.

6.verse: Your goodness is as high as the mountains. Your justice is as deep as the great ocean. LORD, you protect both people and animals.

7.verse: God, your love is so precious! You protect people in the shadow of your wings.

8.verse: They eat the rich food in your house, and you let them drink from your river of pleasure.

9.verse: You are the giver of life. Your light lets us enjoy life.

10.verse: Continue to love those who know you and to do good to those who are good.

11.verse: Don’t let proud people attack me and the wicked force me away.

12.verse: Those who do evil have been defeated. They are overwhelmed; they cannot do evil any longer.

1.verse: God Will Reward Fairly - Of David. Don’t be upset because of evil people. Don’t be jealous of those who do wrong,

2.verse: because like the grass, they will soon dry up. Like green plants, they will soon die away.

3.verse: Trust the LORD and do good. Live in the land and feed on truth.

4.verse: Enjoy serving the LORD, and he will give you what you want.

5.verse: Depend on the LORD; trust him, and he will take care of you.

6.verse: Then your goodness will shine like the sun, and your fairness like the noonday sun.

7.verse: Wait and trust the LORD. Don’t be upset when others get rich or when someone else’s plans succeed.

8.verse: Don’t get angry. Don’t be upset; it only leads to trouble.

9.verse: Evil people will be sent away, but those who trust the LORD will inherit the land.

10.verse: In a little while the wicked will be no more. You may look for them, but they will be gone.

11.verse: People who are not proud will inherit the land and will enjoy complete peace.

12.verse: The wicked make evil plans against good people. They grind their teeth at them in anger.

13.verse: But the Lord laughs at the wicked, because he sees that their day is coming.

14.verse: The wicked draw their swords and bend their bows to kill the poor and helpless, to kill those who are honest.

15.verse: But their swords will stab their own hearts, and their bows will break.

16.verse: It is better to have little and be right than to have much and be wrong.

17.verse: The power of the wicked will be broken, but the LORD supports those who do right.

18.verse: The LORD watches over the lives of the innocent, and their reward will last forever.

19.verse: They will not be ashamed when trouble comes. They will be full in times of hunger.

20.verse: But the wicked will die. The LORD’s enemies will be like the flowers of the fields; they will disappear like smoke.

21.verse: The wicked borrow and don’t pay back, but those who do right give freely to others.

22.verse: Those whom the LORD blesses will inherit the land, but those he curses will be sent away.

23.verse: When people’s steps follow the LORD, God is pleased with their ways.

24.verse: If they stumble, they will not fall, because the LORD holds their hand.

25.verse: I was young, and now I am old, but I have never seen good people left helpless or their children begging for food.

26.verse: Good people always lend freely to others, and their children are a blessing.

27.verse: Stop doing evil and do good, so you will live forever.

28.verse: The LORD loves justice and will not leave those who worship him. He will always protect them, but the children of the wicked will die.

29.verse: Good people will inherit the land and will live in it forever.

30.verse: Good people speak with wisdom, and they say what is fair.

31.verse: The teachings of their God are in their heart, so they do not fail to keep them.

32.verse: The wicked watch for good people so that they may kill them.

33.verse: But the LORD will not take away his protection or let good people be judged guilty.

34.verse: Wait for the LORD’s help and follow him. He will honor you and give you the land, and you will see the wicked sent away.

35.verse: I saw a wicked and cruel man who looked strong like a healthy tree in good soil.

36.verse: But he died and was gone; I looked for him, but he couldn’t be found.

37.verse: Think of the innocent person, and watch the honest one. The man who has peace will have children to live after him.

38.verse: But sinners will be destroyed; in the end the wicked will die.

39.verse: The LORD saves good people; he is their strength in times of trouble.

40.verse: The LORD helps them and saves them; he saves them from the wicked, because they trust in him for protection.

1.verse: A Prayer in Time of Sickness - A psalm of David to remember. LORD, don’t correct me when you are angry. Don’t punish me when you are furious.

2.verse: Your arrows have wounded me, and your hand has come down on me.

3.verse: My body is sick from your punishment. Even my bones are not healthy because of my sin.

4.verse: My guilt has overwhelmed me; like a load it weighs me down.

5.verse: My sores stink and become infected because I was foolish.

6.verse: I am bent over and bowed down; I am sad all day long.

7.verse: I am burning with fever, and my whole body is sore.

8.verse: I am weak and faint. I moan from the pain I feel.

9.verse: Lord, you know everything I want; my cries are not hidden from you.

10.verse: My heart pounds, and my strength is gone. I am losing my sight.

11.verse: Because of my wounds, my friends and neighbors avoid me, and my relatives stay far away.

12.verse: Some people set traps to kill me. Those who want to hurt me plan trouble; all day long they think up lies.

13.verse: I am like the deaf; I cannot hear. Like the mute, I cannot speak.

14.verse: I am like those who do not hear, who have no answer to give.

15.verse: I trust you, LORD. You will answer, my Lord and God.

16.verse: I said, “Don’t let them laugh at me or brag when I am defeated.”

17.verse: I am about to die, and I cannot forget my pain.

18.verse: I confess my guilt; I am troubled by my sin.

19.verse: My enemies are strong and healthy, and many hate me for no reason.

20.verse: They repay me with evil for the good I did. They lie about me because I try to do good.

21.verse: LORD, don’t leave me; my God, don’t go away.

22.verse: Quickly come and help me, my Lord and Savior.

1.verse: Life Is Short - For the director of music. For Jeduthun. A psalm of David. I said, “I will be careful how I act and will not sin by what I say. I will be careful what I say around wicked people.”

2.verse: So I kept very quiet. I didn’t even say anything good, but I became even more upset.

3.verse: I became very angry inside, and as I thought about it, my anger burned. So I spoke:

4.verse: “LORD, tell me when the end will come and how long I will live. Let me know how long I have.

5.verse: You have given me only a short life; my lifetime is like nothing to you. Everyone’s life is only a breath. Selah

6.verse: People are like shadows moving about. All their work is for nothing; they collect things but don’t know who will get them.

7.verse: “So, Lord, what hope do I have? You are my hope.

8.verse: Save me from all my sins. Don’t let wicked fools make fun of me.

9.verse: I am quiet; I do not open my mouth, because you are the one who has done this.

10.verse: Quit punishing me; your beating is about to kill me.

11.verse: You correct and punish people for their sins; like a moth, you destroy what they love. Everyone’s life is only a breath. Selah

12.verse: “LORD, hear my prayer, and listen to my cry. Do not ignore my tears. I am like a visitor with you. Like my ancestors, I’m only here a short time.

13.verse: Leave me alone so I can be happy before I leave and am no more.”

1.verse: Praise and Prayer for Help - For the director of music. A psalm of David. I waited patiently for the LORD. He turned to me and heard my cry.

2.verse: He lifted me out of the pit of destruction, out of the sticky mud. He stood me on a rock and made my feet steady.

3.verse: He put a new song in my mouth, a song of praise to our God. Many people will see this and worship him. Then they will trust the LORD.

4.verse: Happy is the person who trusts the LORD, who doesn’t turn to those who are proud or to those who worship false gods.

5.verse: LORD my God, you have done many miracles. Your plans for us are many. If I tried to tell them all, there would be too many to count.

6.verse: You do not want sacrifices and offerings. But you have made a hole in my ear to show that my body and life are yours. You do not ask for burnt offerings and sacrifices to take away sins.

7.verse: Then I said, “Look, I have come. It is written about me in the book.

8.verse: My God, I want to do what you want. Your teachings are in my heart.”

9.verse: I will tell about your goodness in the great meeting of your people. LORD, you know my lips are not silent.

10.verse: I do not hide your goodness in my heart; I speak about your loyalty and salvation. I do not hide your love and truth from the people in the great meeting.

11.verse: LORD, do not hold back your mercy from me; let your love and truth always protect me.

12.verse: Troubles have surrounded me; there are too many to count. My sins have caught me so that I cannot see a way to escape. I have more sins than hairs on my head, and I have lost my courage.

13.verse: Please, LORD, save me. Hurry, LORD, to help me.

14.verse: People are trying to kill me. Shame them and disgrace them. People want to hurt me. Let them run away in disgrace.

15.verse: People are making fun of me. Let them be shamed into silence.

16.verse: But let those who follow you be happy and glad. They love you for saving them. May they always say, “Praise the LORD!”

17.verse: Lord, because I am poor and helpless, please remember me. You are my helper and savior. My God, do not wait.

1.verse: A Prayer in Time of Sickness - For the director of music. A psalm of David. Happy are those who think about the poor. When trouble comes, the LORD will save them.

2.verse: The LORD will protect them and spare their life and will bless them in the land. He will not let their enemies take them.

3.verse: The LORD will give them strength when they are sick, and he will make them well again.

4.verse: I said, “LORD, have mercy on me. Heal me, because I have sinned against you.”

5.verse: My enemies are saying evil things about me. They say, “When will he die and be forgotten?”

6.verse: Some people come to see me, but they lie. They just come to get bad news. Then they go and gossip.

7.verse: All my enemies whisper about me and think the worst about me.

8.verse: They say, “He has a terrible disease. He will never get out of bed again.”

9.verse: My best and truest friend, who ate at my table, has even turned against me.

10.verse: LORD, have mercy on me. Give me strength so I can pay them back.

11.verse: Because my enemies do not defeat me, I know you are pleased with me.

12.verse: Because I am innocent, you support me and will let me be with you forever.

13.verse: Praise the LORD, the God of Israel. He has always been, and he will always be. Amen and amen.

1.verse: Wishing to Be Near God - For the director of music. A maskil of the sons of Korah. As a deer thirsts for streams of water, so I thirst for you, God.

2.verse: I thirst for the living God. When can I go to meet with him?

3.verse: Day and night, my tears have been my food. People are always saying, “Where is your God?”

4.verse: When I remember these things, I speak with a broken heart. I used to walk with the crowd and lead them to God’s Temple with songs of praise.

5.verse: Why am I so sad? Why am I so upset? I should put my hope in God and keep praising him, my Savior and

6.verse: my God. I am very sad. So I remember you where the Jordan River begins, near the peaks of Hermon and Mount Mizar.

7.verse: Troubles have come again and again, sounding like waterfalls. Your waves are crashing all around me.

8.verse: The LORD shows his true love every day. At night I have a song, and I pray to my living God.

9.verse: I say to God, my Rock, “Why have you forgotten me? Why am I sad and troubled by my enemies?”

10.verse: My enemies’ insults make me feel as if my bones were broken. They are always saying, “Where is your God?”

11.verse: Why am I so sad? Why am I so upset? I should put my hope in God and keep praising him, my Savior and my God.

1.verse: A Prayer for Protection - God, defend me. Argue my case against those who don’t follow you. Save me from liars and those who do evil.

2.verse: God, you are my strength. Why have you rejected me? Why am I sad and troubled by my enemies?

3.verse: Send me your light and truth to guide me. Let them lead me to your holy mountain, to where you live.

4.verse: Then I will go to the altar of God, to God who is my joy and happiness. I will praise you with a harp, God, my God.

5.verse: Why am I so sad? Why am I so upset? I should put my hope in God and keep praising him, my Savior and my God.

1.verse: A Prayer for Help - For the director of music. A maskil of the sons of Korah. God, we have heard about you. Our ancestors told us what you did in their days, in days long ago.

2.verse: With your power you forced the nations out of the land and placed our ancestors here. You destroyed those other nations, but you made our ancestors grow strong.

3.verse: It wasn’t their swords that took the land. It wasn’t their power that gave them victory. But it was your great power and strength. You were with them because you loved them.

4.verse: My God, you are my King. Your commands led Jacob’s people to victory.

5.verse: With your help we pushed back our enemies. In your name we trampled those who came against us.

6.verse: I don’t trust my bow to help me, and my sword can’t save me.

7.verse: You saved us from our foes, and you made our enemies ashamed.

8.verse: We will praise God every day; we will praise your name forever. Selah

9.verse: But you have rejected us and shamed us. You don’t march with our armies anymore.

10.verse: You let our enemies push us back, and those who hate us have taken our wealth.

11.verse: You gave us away like sheep to be eaten and have scattered us among the nations.

12.verse: You sold your people for nothing and made no profit on the sale.

13.verse: You made us a joke to our neighbors; those around us laugh and make fun of us.

14.verse: You made us a joke to the other nations; people shake their heads.

15.verse: I am always in disgrace, and I am covered with shame.

16.verse: My enemy is getting even with insults and curses.

17.verse: All these things have happened to us, but we have not forgotten you or failed to keep our agreement with you.

18.verse: Our hearts haven’t turned away from you, and we haven’t stopped following you.

19.verse: But you crushed us in this place where wild dogs live, and you covered us with deep darkness.

20.verse: If we had forgotten our God or lifted our hands in prayer to foreign gods,

21.verse: God would have known, because he knows what is in our hearts.

22.verse: But for you we are in danger of death all the time. People think we are worth no more than sheep to be killed.

23.verse: Wake up, Lord! Why are you sleeping? Get up! Don’t reject us forever.

24.verse: Why do you hide from us? Have you forgotten our pain and troubles?

25.verse: We have been pushed down into the dirt; we are flat on the ground.

26.verse: Get up and help us. Because of your love, save us.

1.verse: A Song for the King’s Wedding - For the director of music. To the tune of “Lilies.” A maskil. A love song of the sons of Korah. Beautiful words fill my mind. I am speaking of royal things. My tongue is like the pen of a skilled writer.

2.verse: You are more handsome than anyone, and you are an excellent speaker, so God has blessed you forever.

3.verse: Put on your sword, powerful warrior. Show your glory and majesty.

4.verse: In your majesty win the victory for what is true and right. Your power will do amazing things.

5.verse: Your sharp arrows will enter the hearts of the king’s enemies. Nations will be defeated before you.

6.verse: God, your throne will last forever and ever. You will rule your kingdom with fairness.

7.verse: You love right and hate evil, so God has chosen you from among your friends; he has set you apart with much joy.

8.verse: Your clothes smell like myrrh, aloes, and cassia. From palaces of ivory music comes to make you happy.

9.verse: Kings’ daughters are among your honored women. Your bride stands at your right side wearing gold from Ophir.

10.verse: Listen to me, daughter; look and pay attention. Forget your people and your father’s family.

11.verse: The king loves your beauty. Because he is your master, you should obey him.

12.verse: People from the city of Tyre have brought a gift. Wealthy people will want to meet you.

13.verse: The princess is very beautiful. Her gown is woven with gold.

14.verse: In her beautiful clothes she is brought to the king. Her bridesmaids follow behind her, and they are also brought to him.

15.verse: They come with happiness and joy; they enter the king’s palace.

16.verse: You will have sons to replace your fathers. You will make them rulers through all the land.

17.verse: I will make your name famous from now on, so people will praise you forever and ever.

1.verse: God Protects His People - For the director of music. By alamoth. A psalm of the sons of Korah. God is our protection and our strength. He always helps in times of trouble.

2.verse: So we will not be afraid even if the earth shakes, or the mountains fall into the sea,

3.verse: even if the oceans roar and foam, or the mountains shake at the raging sea. Selah

4.verse: There is a river that brings joy to the city of God, the holy place where God Most High lives.

5.verse: God is in that city, and so it will not be shaken. God will help her at dawn.

6.verse: Nations tremble and kingdoms shake. God shouts and the earth crumbles.

7.verse: The LORD All-Powerful is with us; the God of Jacob is our defender. Selah

8.verse: Come and see what the LORD has done, the amazing things he has done on the earth.

9.verse: He stops wars everywhere on the earth. He breaks all bows and spears and burns up the chariots with fire.

10.verse: God says, “Be still and know that I am God. I will be praised in all the nations; I will be praised throughout the earth.”

11.verse: The LORD All-Powerful is with us; the God of Jacob is our defender. Selah

1.verse: God, the King of the World - For the director of music. A psalm of the sons of Korah. Clap your hands, all you people. Shout to God with joy.

2.verse: The LORD Most High is wonderful. He is the great King over all the earth!

3.verse: He defeated nations for us and put them under our control.

4.verse: He chose the land we would inherit. We are the children of Jacob, whom he loved. Selah

5.verse: God has risen with a shout of joy; the LORD has risen as the trumpets sounded.

6.verse: Sing praises to God. Sing praises. Sing praises to our King. Sing praises.

7.verse: God is King of all the earth, so sing a song of praise to him.

8.verse: God is King over the nations. God sits on his holy throne.

9.verse: The leaders of the nations meet with the people of the God of Abraham, because the leaders of the earth belong to God. He is supreme.

1.verse: Jerusalem, the City of God - A psalm of the sons of Korah. The LORD is great; he should be praised in the city of our God, on his holy mountain.

2.verse: It is high and beautiful and brings joy to the whole world. Mount Zion is like the high mountains of the north; it is the city of the Great King.

3.verse: God is within its palaces; he is known as its defender.

4.verse: Kings joined together and came to attack the city.

5.verse: But when they saw it, they were amazed. They ran away in fear.

6.verse: Fear took hold of them; they hurt like a woman having a baby.

7.verse: You destroyed the large trading ships with an east wind.

8.verse: First we heard and now we have seen that God will always keep his city safe. It is the city of the LORD All-Powerful, the city of our God. Selah

9.verse: God, we come into your Temple to think about your love.

10.verse: God, your name is known everywhere; all over the earth people praise you. Your right hand is full of goodness.

11.verse: Mount Zion is happy and all the towns of Judah rejoice, because your decisions are fair.

12.verse: Walk around Jerusalem and count its towers.

13.verse: Notice how strong they are. Look at the palaces. Then you can tell your children about them.

14.verse: This God is our God forever and ever. He will guide us from now on.

1.verse: Trusting Money Is Foolish - For the director of music. A psalm of the sons of Korah. Listen to this, all you nations; listen, all you who live on earth.

2.verse: Listen, both great and small, rich and poor together.

3.verse: What I say is wise, and my heart speaks with understanding.

4.verse: I will pay attention to a wise saying; I will explain my riddle on the harp.

5.verse: Why should I be afraid of bad days? Why should I fear when evil people surround me?

6.verse: They trust in their money and brag about their riches.

7.verse: No one can buy back the life of another. No one can pay God for his own life,

8.verse: because the price of a life is high. No payment is ever enough.

9.verse: Do people live forever? Don’t they all face death?

10.verse: See, even wise people die. Fools and stupid people also die and leave their wealth to others.

11.verse: Their graves will always be their homes. They will live there from now on, even though they named places after themselves.

12.verse: Even rich people do not live forever; like the animals, people die.

13.verse: This is what will happen to those who trust in themselves and to their followers who believe them. Selah

14.verse: Like sheep, they must die, and death will be their shepherd. Honest people will rule over them in the morning, and their bodies will rot in a grave far from home.

15.verse: But God will save my life and will take me from the grave. Selah

16.verse: Don’t be afraid of rich people because their houses are more beautiful.

17.verse: They don’t take anything to the grave; their wealth won’t go down with them.

18.verse: Even though they were praised when they were alive— and people may praise you when you succeed—

19.verse: they will go to where their ancestors are. They will never see light again.

20.verse: Rich people with no understanding are just like animals that die.

1.verse: God Wants True Worship - A psalm of Asaph. The God of gods, the LORD, speaks. He calls the earth from the rising to the setting sun.

2.verse: God shines from Jerusalem, whose beauty is perfect.

3.verse: Our God comes, and he will not be silent. A fire burns in front of him, and a powerful storm surrounds him.

4.verse: He calls to the sky above and to the earth that he might judge his people.

5.verse: He says, “Gather around, you who worship me, who have made an agreement with me, using a sacrifice.”

6.verse: God is the judge, and even the skies say he is right. Selah

7.verse: God says, “My people, listen to me; Israel, I will testify against you. I am God, your God.

8.verse: I do not scold you for your sacrifices. You always bring me your burnt offerings.

9.verse: But I do not need bulls from your stalls or goats from your pens,

10.verse: because every animal of the forest is already mine. The cattle on a thousand hills are mine.

11.verse: I know every bird on the mountains, and every living thing in the fields is mine.

12.verse: If I were hungry, I would not tell you, because the earth and everything in it are mine.

13.verse: I don’t eat the meat of bulls or drink the blood of goats.

14.verse: Give an offering to show thanks to God. Give God Most High what you have promised.

15.verse: Call to me in times of trouble. I will save you, and you will honor me.”

16.verse: But God says to the wicked, “Why do you talk about my laws? Why do you mention my agreement?

17.verse: You hate my teachings and turn your back on what I say.

18.verse: When you see a thief, you join him. You take part in adultery.

19.verse: You don’t stop your mouth from speaking evil, and your tongue makes up lies.

20.verse: You speak against your brother and lie about your mother’s son.

21.verse: I have kept quiet while you did these things, so you thought I was just like you. But I will scold you and accuse you to your face.

22.verse: “Think about this, you who forget God. Otherwise, I will tear you apart, and no one will save you.

23.verse: Those people honor me who bring me offerings to show thanks. And I, God, will save those who do that.”

1.verse: A Prayer for Forgiveness - For the director of music. A psalm of David when the prophet Nathan came to David after David’s sin with Bathsheba. God, be merciful to me because you are loving. Because you are always ready to be merciful, wipe out all my wrongs.

2.verse: Wash away all my guilt and make me clean again.

3.verse: I know about my wrongs, and I can’t forget my sin.

4.verse: You are the only one I have sinned against; I have done what you say is wrong. You are right when you speak and fair when you judge.

5.verse: I was brought into this world in sin. In sin my mother gave birth to me.

6.verse: You want me to be completely truthful, so teach me wisdom.

7.verse: Take away my sin, and I will be clean. Wash me, and I will be whiter than snow.

8.verse: Make me hear sounds of joy and gladness; let the bones you crushed be happy again.

9.verse: Turn your face from my sins and wipe out all my guilt.

10.verse: Create in me a pure heart, God, and make my spirit right again.

11.verse: Do not send me away from you or take your Holy Spirit away from me.

12.verse: Give me back the joy of your salvation. Keep me strong by giving me a willing spirit.

13.verse: Then I will teach your ways to those who do wrong, and sinners will turn back to you.

14.verse: God, save me from the guilt of murder, God of my salvation, and I will sing about your goodness.

15.verse: Lord, let me speak so I may praise you.

16.verse: You are not pleased by sacrifices, or I would give them. You don’t want burnt offerings.

17.verse: The sacrifice God wants is a broken spirit. God, you will not reject a heart that is broken and sorry for sin.

18.verse: Do whatever good you wish for Jerusalem. Rebuild the walls of Jerusalem.

19.verse: Then you will be pleased with right sacrifices and whole burnt offerings, and bulls will be offered on your altar.

1.verse: God Will Punish the Proud - For the director of music. A maskil of David. When Doeg the Edomite came to Saul and said to him, “David is in Ahimelech’s house.” Mighty warrior, why do you brag about the evil you do? God’s love will continue forever.

2.verse: You think up evil plans. Your tongue is like a sharp razor, making up lies.

3.verse: You love wrong more than right and lies more than truth. Selah

4.verse: You love words that bite and tongues that lie.

5.verse: But God will ruin you forever. He will grab you and throw you out of your tent; he will tear you away from the land of the living. Selah

6.verse: Those who do right will see this and fear God. They will laugh at you and say,

7.verse: “Look what happened to the man who did not depend on God but depended on his money. He grew strong by his evil plans.”

8.verse: But I am like an olive tree growing in God’s Temple. I trust God’s love forever and ever.

9.verse: God, I will thank you forever for what you have done. With those who worship you, I will trust you because you are good.

1.verse: The Unbelieving Fool - For the director of music. By mahalath. A maskil of David. Fools say to themselves, “There is no God.” Fools are evil and do terrible things; none of them does anything good.

2.verse: God looked down from heaven on all people to see if anyone was wise, if anyone was looking to God for help.

3.verse: But all have turned away. Together, everyone has become evil; none of them does anything good. Not a single person.

4.verse: Don’t the wicked understand? They destroy my people as if they were eating bread. They do not ask God for help.

5.verse: The wicked are filled with terror where there had been nothing to fear. God will scatter the bones of your enemies. You will defeat them, because God has rejected them.

6.verse: I pray that victory will come to Israel from Mount Zion! May God bring them back. Then the people of Jacob will rejoice, and the people of Israel will be glad.

1.verse: A Prayer for Help - For the director of music. With stringed instruments. A maskil of David when the Ziphites went to Saul and said, “We think David is hiding among our people.” God, save me because of who you are. By your strength show that I am innocent.

2.verse: Hear my prayer, God; listen to what I say.
