3.verse: Strangers turn against me, and cruel people want to kill me. They do not care about God. Selah

4.verse: See, God will help me; the Lord will support me.

5.verse: Let my enemies be punished with their own evil. Destroy them because you are loyal to me.

6.verse: I will offer a sacrifice as a special gift to you. I will thank you, LORD, because you are good.

7.verse: You have saved me from all my troubles, and I have seen my enemies defeated.

1.verse: A Prayer About a False Friend - For the director of music. With stringed instruments. A maskil of David. God, listen to my prayer and do not ignore my cry for help.

2.verse: Pay attention to me and answer me. I am troubled and upset

3.verse: by what the enemy says and how the wicked look at me. They bring troubles down on me, and in anger they attack me.

4.verse: I am frightened inside; the terror of death has attacked me.

5.verse: I am scared and shaking, and terror grips me.

6.verse: I said, “I wish I had wings like a dove. Then I would fly away and rest.

7.verse: I would wander far away and stay in the desert. Selah

8.verse: I would hurry to my place of escape, far away from the wind and storm.”

9.verse: Lord, destroy and confuse their words, because I see violence and fighting in the city.

10.verse: Day and night they are all around its walls, and evil and trouble are everywhere inside.

11.verse: Destruction is everywhere in the city; trouble and lying never leave its streets.

12.verse: It was not an enemy insulting me. I could stand that. It was not someone who hated me. I could hide from him.

13.verse: But it is you, a person like me, my companion and good friend.

14.verse: We had a good friendship and walked together to God’s Temple.

15.verse: Let death take away my enemies. Let them die while they are still young because evil lives with them.

16.verse: But I will call to God for help, and the LORD will save me.

17.verse: Morning, noon, and night I am troubled and upset, but he will listen to me.

18.verse: Many are against me, but he keeps me safe in battle.

19.verse: God who lives forever will hear me and punish them. Selah But they will not change; they do not fear God.

20.verse: The one who was my friend attacks his friends and breaks his promises.

21.verse: His words are slippery like butter, but war is in his heart. His words are smoother than oil, but they cut like knives.

22.verse: Give your worries to the LORD, and he will take care of you. He will never let good people down.

23.verse: But, God, you will bring down the wicked to the grave. Murderers and liars will live only half a lifetime. But I will trust in you.

1.verse: Trusting God for Help - For the director of music. To the tune of “The Dove in the Distant Oak.” A miktam of David when the Philistines captured him in Gath. God, be merciful to me because people are chasing me; the battle has pressed me all day long.

2.verse: My enemies have chased me all day; there are many proud people fighting me.

3.verse: When I am afraid, I will trust you.

4.verse: I praise God for his word. I trust God, so I am not afraid. What can human beings do to me?

5.verse: All day long they twist my words; all their evil plans are against me.

6.verse: They wait. They hide. They watch my steps, hoping to kill me.

7.verse: God, do not let them escape; punish the foreign nations in your anger.

8.verse: You have recorded my troubles. You have kept a list of my tears. Aren’t they in your records?

9.verse: On the day I call for help, my enemies will be defeated. I know that God is on my side.

10.verse: I praise God for his word to me; I praise the LORD for his word.

11.verse: I trust in God. I will not be afraid. What can people do to me?

12.verse: God, I must keep my promises to you. I will give you my offerings to thank you,

13.verse: because you have saved me from death. You have kept me from being defeated. So I will walk with God in light among the living.

1.verse: A Prayer in Troubled Times - For the director of music. To the tune of “Do Not Destroy.” A miktam of David when he escaped from Saul in the cave. Be merciful to me, God; be merciful to me because I come to you for protection. Let me hide under the shadow of your wings until the trouble has passed.

2.verse: I cry out to God Most High, to the God who does everything for me.

3.verse: He sends help from heaven and saves me. He punishes those who chase me. Selah God sends me his love and truth.

4.verse: Enemies, like lions, are all around me; I must lie down among them. Their teeth are like spears and arrows, their tongues as sharp as swords.

5.verse: God is supreme over the skies; his majesty covers the earth.

6.verse: They set a trap for me. I am very worried. They dug a pit in my path, but they fell into it themselves. Selah

7.verse: My heart is steady, God; my heart is steady. I will sing and praise you.

8.verse: Wake up, my soul. Wake up, harp and lyre! I will wake up the dawn.

9.verse: Lord, I will praise you among the nations; I will sing songs of praise about you to all the nations.

10.verse: Your great love reaches to the skies, your truth to the clouds.

11.verse: God, you are supreme above the skies. Let your glory be over all the earth.

1.verse: Unfair Judges - For the director of music. To the tune of “Do Not Destroy.” A miktam of David. Do you rulers really say what is right? Do you judge people fairly?

2.verse: No, in your heart you plan evil; you think up violent crimes in the land.

3.verse: From birth, evil people turn away from God; they wander off and tell lies as soon as they are born.

4.verse: They are like poisonous snakes, like deaf cobras that stop up their ears

5.verse: so they cannot hear the music of the snake charmer no matter how well he plays.

6.verse: God, break the teeth in their mouths! Tear out the fangs of those lions, LORD!

7.verse: Let them disappear like water that flows away. Let them be cut short like a broken arrow.

8.verse: Let them be like snails that melt as they move. Let them be like a child born dead who never saw the sun.

9.verse: His anger will blow them away alive faster than burning thorns can heat a pot.

10.verse: Good people will be glad when they see him get even. They will wash their feet in the blood of the wicked.

11.verse: Then people will say, “There really are rewards for doing what is right. There really is a God who judges the world.”

1.verse: A Prayer for Protection - For the director of music. To the tune of “Do Not Destroy.” A miktam of David when Saul sent men to watch David’s house to kill him. God, save me from my enemies. Protect me from those who come against me.

2.verse: Save me from those who do evil and from murderers.

3.verse: Look, they are waiting to ambush me. Cruel people attack me, but I have not sinned or done wrong, LORD.

4.verse: I have done nothing wrong, but they are ready to attack me. Wake up to help me, and look.

5.verse: You are the LORD God All-Powerful, the God of Israel. Arise and punish those people. Do not give those traitors any mercy. Selah

6.verse: They come back at night. Like dogs they growl and roam around the city.

7.verse: Notice what comes from their mouths. Insults come from their lips, because they say, “Who’s listening?”

8.verse: But, LORD, you laugh at them; you make fun of all of them.

9.verse: God, my strength, I am looking to you, because God is my defender.

10.verse: My God loves me, and he goes in front of me. He will help me defeat my enemies.

11.verse: Lord, our protector, do not kill them, or my people will forget. With your power scatter them and defeat them.

12.verse: They sin by what they say; they sin with their words. They curse and tell lies, so let their pride trap them.

13.verse: Destroy them in your anger; destroy them completely! Then they will know that God rules over Israel and to the ends of the earth. Selah

14.verse: They come back at night. Like dogs they growl and roam around the city.

15.verse: They wander about looking for food, and they howl if they do not find enough.

16.verse: But I will sing about your strength. In the morning I will sing about your love. You are my defender, my place of safety in times of trouble.

17.verse: God, my strength, I will sing praises to you. God, my defender, you are the God who loves me.

1.verse: A Prayer After a Defeat - For the director of music. To the tune of “Lily of the Agreement.” A miktam of David. For teaching. When David fought the Arameans of Northwest Mesopotamia and Zobah, and when Joab returned and defeated twelve thousand Edomites at the Valley of Salt. God, you have rejected us and scattered us. You have been angry, but please come back to us.

2.verse: You made the earth shake and crack. Heal its breaks because it is shaking.

3.verse: You have given your people trouble. You made us unable to walk straight, like people drunk with wine.

4.verse: You have raised a banner to gather those who fear you. Now they can stand up against the enemy. Selah

5.verse: Answer us and save us by your power so the people you love will be rescued.

6.verse: God has said from his Temple, “When I win, I will divide Shechem and measure off the Valley of Succoth.

7.verse: Gilead and Manasseh are mine. Ephraim is like my helmet. Judah holds my royal scepter.

8.verse: Moab is like my washbowl. I throw my sandals at Edom. I shout at Philistia.”

9.verse: Who will bring me to the strong, walled city? Who will lead me to Edom?

10.verse: God, surely you have rejected us; you do not go out with our armies.

11.verse: Help us fight the enemy. Human help is useless,

12.verse: but we can win with God’s help. He will defeat our enemies.

1.verse: A Prayer for Protection - For the director of music. With stringed instruments. Of David. God, hear my cry; listen to my prayer.

2.verse: I call to you from the ends of the earth when I am afraid. Carry me away to a high mountain.

3.verse: You have been my protection, like a strong tower against my enemies.

4.verse: Let me live in your Holy Tent forever. Let me find safety in the shelter of your wings. Selah

5.verse: God, you have heard my promises. You have given me what belongs to those who fear you.

6.verse: Give the king a long life; let him live many years.

7.verse: Let him rule in the presence of God forever. Protect him with your love and truth.

8.verse: Then I will praise your name forever, and every day I will keep my promises.

1.verse: Trust Only in God - For the director of music. For Jeduthun. A psalm of David. I find rest in God; only he can save me.

2.verse: He is my rock and my salvation. He is my defender; I will not be defeated.

3.verse: How long will you attack someone? Will all of you kill that person? Who is like a leaning wall, like a fence ready to fall?

4.verse: They are planning to make that person fall. They enjoy telling lies. With their mouths they bless, but in their hearts they curse. Selah

5.verse: I find rest in God; only he gives me hope.

6.verse: He is my rock and my salvation. He is my defender; I will not be defeated.

7.verse: My honor and salvation come from God. He is my mighty rock and my protection.

8.verse: People, trust God all the time. Tell him all your problems, because God is our protection. Selah

9.verse: The least of people are only a breath, and even the greatest are just a lie. On the scales, they weigh nothing; together they are only a breath.

10.verse: Do not trust in force. Stealing is of no use. Even if you gain more riches, don’t put your trust in them.

11.verse: God has said this, and I have heard it over and over: God is strong.

12.verse: The Lord is loving. You reward people for what they have done.

1.verse: Wishing to Be Near God - A psalm of David when he was in the desert of Judah. God, you are my God. I search for you. I thirst for you like someone in a dry, empty land where there is no water.

2.verse: I have seen you in the Temple and have seen your strength and glory.

3.verse: Because your love is better than life, I will praise you.

4.verse: I will praise you as long as I live. I will lift up my hands in prayer to your name.

5.verse: I will be content as if I had eaten the best foods. My lips will sing, and my mouth will praise you.

6.verse: I remember you while I’m lying in bed; I think about you through the night.

7.verse: You are my help. Because of your protection, I sing.

8.verse: I stay close to you; you support me with your right hand.

9.verse: Some people are trying to kill me, but they will go down to the grave.

10.verse: They will be killed with swords and eaten by wild dogs.

11.verse: But the king will rejoice in his God. All who make promises in his name will praise him, but the mouths of liars will be shut.

1.verse: A Prayer Against Enemies - For the director of music. A psalm of David. God, listen to my complaint. I am afraid of my enemies; protect my life from them.

2.verse: Hide me from those who plan wicked things, from that gang who does evil.

3.verse: They sharpen their tongues like swords and shoot bitter words like arrows.

4.verse: From their hiding places they shoot at innocent people; they shoot suddenly and are not afraid.

5.verse: They encourage each other to do wrong. They talk about setting traps, thinking no one will see them.

6.verse: They plan wicked things and say, “We have a perfect plan.” The mind of human beings is hard to understand.

7.verse: But God will shoot them with arrows; they will suddenly be struck down.

8.verse: Their own words will be used against them. All who see them will shake their heads.

9.verse: Then everyone will fear God. They will tell what God has done, and they will learn from what he has done.

10.verse: Good people will be happy in the LORD and will find protection in him. Let everyone who is honest praise the LORD.

1.verse: A Hymn of Thanksgiving - For the director of music. A psalm of David. A song. God, you will be praised in Jerusalem. We will keep our promises to you.

2.verse: You hear our prayers. All people will come to you.

3.verse: Our guilt overwhelms us, but you forgive our sins.

4.verse: Happy are the people you choose and invite to stay in your court. We are filled with good things in your house, your holy Temple.

5.verse: You answer us in amazing ways, God our Savior. People everywhere on the earth and beyond the sea trust you.

6.verse: You made the mountains by your strength; you are dressed in power.

7.verse: You stopped the roaring seas, the roaring waves, and the uproar of the nations.

8.verse: Even those people at the ends of the earth fear your miracles. You are praised from where the sun rises to where it sets.

9.verse: You take care of the land and water it; you make it very fertile. The rivers of God are full of water. Grain grows because you make it grow.

10.verse: You send rain to the plowed fields; you fill the rows with water. You soften the ground with rain, and then you bless it with crops.

11.verse: You give the year a good harvest, and you load the wagons with many crops.

12.verse: The desert is covered with grass and the hills with happiness.

13.verse: The pastures are full of flocks, and the valleys are covered with grain. Everything shouts and sings for joy.

1.verse: Praise God for What He Has Done - For the director of music. A song. A psalm. Everything on earth, shout with joy to God!

2.verse: Sing about his glory! Make his praise glorious!

3.verse: Say to God, “Your works are amazing! Because your power is great, your enemies fall before you.

4.verse: All the earth worships you and sings praises to you. They sing praises to your name.” Selah

5.verse: Come and see what God has done, the amazing things he has done for people.

6.verse: He turned the sea into dry land. The people crossed the river on foot. So let us rejoice because of what he did.

7.verse: He rules forever with his power. He keeps his eye on the nations, so people should not turn against him. Selah

8.verse: You people, praise our God; loudly sing his praise.

9.verse: He protects our lives and does not let us be defeated.

10.verse: God, you have tested us; you have purified us like silver.

11.verse: You let us be trapped and put a heavy load on us.

12.verse: You let our enemies walk on our heads. We went through fire and flood, but you brought us to a place with good things.

13.verse: I will come to your Temple with burnt offerings. I will give you what I promised,

14.verse: things I promised when I was in trouble.

15.verse: I will bring you offerings of fat animals, and I will offer sheep, bulls, and goats. Selah

16.verse: All of you who fear God, come and listen, and I will tell you what he has done for me.

17.verse: I cried out to him with my mouth and praised him with my tongue.

18.verse: If I had known of any sin in my heart, the Lord would not have listened to me.

19.verse: But God has listened; he has heard my prayer.

20.verse: Praise God, who did not ignore my prayer or hold back his love from me.

1.verse: Everyone Should Praise God - For the director of music. With stringed instruments. A psalm. A song. God, have mercy on us and bless us and show us your kindness Selah

2.verse: so the world will learn your ways, and all nations will learn that you can save.

3.verse: God, the people should praise you; all people should praise you.

4.verse: The nations should be glad and sing because you judge people fairly. You guide all the nations on earth. Selah

5.verse: God, the people should praise you; all people should praise you.

6.verse: The land has given its crops. God, our God, blesses us.

7.verse: God blesses us so people all over the earth will fear him.

1.verse: Praise God Who Saved the Nation - For the director of music. A psalm of David. A song. Let God rise up and scatter his enemies; let those who hate him run away from him.

2.verse: Blow them away as smoke is driven away by the wind. As wax melts before a fire, let the wicked be destroyed before God.

3.verse: But those who do right should be glad and should rejoice before God; they should be happy and glad.

4.verse: Sing to God; sing praises to his name. Prepare the way for him who rides through the desert, whose name is the LORD. Rejoice before him.

5.verse: God is in his holy Temple. He is a father to orphans, and he defends the widows.

6.verse: God gives the lonely a home. He leads prisoners out with joy, but those who turn against God will live in a dry land.

7.verse: God, you led your people out when you marched through the desert. Selah

8.verse: The ground shook and the sky poured down rain before God, the God of Mount Sinai, before God, the God of Israel.

9.verse: God, you sent much rain; you refreshed your tired land.

10.verse: Your people settled there. God, in your goodness you took care of the poor.

11.verse: The Lord gave the command, and a great army told the news:

12.verse: “Kings and their armies run away. In camp they divide the wealth taken in war.

13.verse: Those who stayed by the campfires will share the riches taken in battle.”

14.verse: The Almighty scattered kings like snow on Mount Zalmon.

15.verse: The mountains of Bashan are high; the mountains of Bashan have many peaks.

16.verse: Why do you mountains with many peaks look with envy on the mountain that God chose for his home? The LORD will live there forever.

17.verse: God comes with millions of chariots; the Lord comes from Mount Sinai to his holy place.

18.verse: When you went up to the heights, you led a parade of captives. You received gifts from the people, even from those who turned against you. And the LORD God will live there.

19.verse: Praise the Lord, God our Savior, who helps us every day. Selah

20.verse: Our God is a God who saves us; the LORD God saves us from death.

21.verse: God will crush his enemies’ heads, the hairy skulls of those who continue to sin.

22.verse: The Lord said, “I will bring the enemy back from Bashan; I will bring them back from the depths of the sea.

23.verse: Then you can stick your feet in their blood, and your dogs can lick their share.”

24.verse: God, people have seen your victory march; God my King marched into the holy place.

25.verse: The singers are in front and the instruments are behind. In the middle are the girls with the tambourines.

26.verse: Praise God in the meeting place; praise the LORD in the gathering of Israel.

27.verse: There is the smallest tribe, Benjamin, leading them. And there are the leaders of Judah with their group. There also are the leaders of Zebulun and of Naphtali.

28.verse: God, order up your power; show the mighty power you have used for us before.

29.verse: Kings will bring their wealth to you, to your Temple in Jerusalem.

30.verse: Punish Egypt, the beast in the tall grass along the river. Punish the leaders of nations, those bulls among the cows. Defeated, they will bring you their silver. Scatter those nations that love war.

31.verse: Messengers will come from Egypt; the people of Cush will pray to God.

32.verse: Kingdoms of the earth, sing to God; sing praises to the Lord. Selah

33.verse: Sing to the one who rides through the skies, which are from long ago. He speaks with a thundering voice.

34.verse: Announce that God is powerful. He rules over Israel, and his power is in the skies.

35.verse: God, you are wonderful in your Temple. The God of Israel gives his people strength and power. Praise God!

1.verse: A Cry for Help - For the director of music. To the tune of “Lilies.” A psalm of David. God, save me, because the water has risen to my neck.

2.verse: I’m sinking down into the mud, and there is nothing to stand on. I am in deep water, and the flood covers me.

3.verse: I am tired from calling for help; my throat is sore. My eyes are tired from waiting for God to help me.

4.verse: There are more people who hate me for no reason than hairs on my head; powerful enemies want to destroy me for no reason. They make me pay back what I did not steal.

5.verse: God, you know what I have done wrong; I cannot hide my guilt from you.

6.verse: Lord GOD All-Powerful, do not let those who hope in you be ashamed because of me. God of Israel, do not let your worshipers be disgraced because of me.

7.verse: For you, I carry this shame, and my face is covered with disgrace.

8.verse: I am like a stranger to my closest relatives and a foreigner to my mother’s children.

9.verse: My strong love for your Temple completely controls me. When people insult you, it hurts me.

10.verse: When I cry and fast, they make fun of me.

11.verse: When I wear clothes of sadness, they joke about me.

12.verse: They make fun of me in public places, and the drunkards make up songs about me.

13.verse: But I pray to you, LORD, for favor. God, because of your great love, answer me. You are truly able to save.

14.verse: Pull me from the mud, and do not let me sink. Save me from those who hate me and from the deep water.

15.verse: Do not let the flood drown me or the deep water swallow me or the grave close its mouth over me.

16.verse: LORD, answer me because your love is so good. Because of your great kindness, turn to me.

17.verse: Do not hide from me, your servant. I am in trouble. Hurry to help me!

18.verse: Come near and save me; rescue me from my enemies.

19.verse: You see my shame and disgrace. You know all my enemies and what they have said.

20.verse: Insults have broken my heart and left me weak. I looked for sympathy, but there was none; I found no one to comfort me.

21.verse: They put poison in my food and gave me vinegar to drink.

22.verse: Let their own feasts cause their ruin; let their feasts trap them and pay them back.

23.verse: Let their eyes be closed so they cannot see and their backs be forever weak from troubles.

24.verse: Pour your anger out on them; let your anger catch up with them.

25.verse: May their place be empty; leave no one to live in their tents.

26.verse: They chase after those you have hurt, and they talk about the pain of those you have wounded.

27.verse: Charge them with crime after crime, and do not let them have anything good.

28.verse: Wipe their names from the book of life, and do not list them with those who do what is right.

29.verse: I am sad and hurting. God, save me and protect me.

30.verse: I will praise God in a song and will honor him by giving thanks.

31.verse: That will please the LORD more than offering him cattle, more than sacrificing a bull with horns and hoofs.

32.verse: Poor people will see this and be glad. Be encouraged, you who worship God.

33.verse: The LORD listens to those in need and does not look down on captives.

34.verse: Heaven and earth should praise him, the seas and everything in them.

35.verse: God will save Jerusalem and rebuild the cities of Judah. Then people will live there and own the land.

36.verse: The descendants of his servants will inherit that land, and those who love him will live there.

1.verse: A Cry for God to Help Quickly - For the director of music. A psalm of David. To help people remember. God, come quickly and save me. LORD, hurry to help me.

2.verse: Let those who are trying to kill me be ashamed and disgraced. Let those who want to hurt me run away in disgrace.

3.verse: Let those who make fun of me stop because of their shame.

4.verse: But let all those who worship you rejoice and be glad. Let those who love your salvation always say, “Praise the greatness of God.”

5.verse: I am poor and helpless; God, hurry to me. You help me and save me. LORD, do not wait.

1.verse: An Old Person’s Prayer - In you, LORD, is my protection. Never let me be ashamed.

2.verse: Because you do what is right, save and rescue me; listen to me and save me.

3.verse: Be my place of safety where I can always come. Give the command to save me, because you are my rock and my strong, walled city.

4.verse: My God, save me from the power of the wicked and from the hold of evil and cruel people.

5.verse: LORD, you are my hope. LORD, I have trusted you since I was young.

6.verse: I have depended on you since I was born; you helped me even on the day of my birth. I will always praise you.

7.verse: I am an example to many people, because you are my strong protection.

8.verse: I am always praising you; all day long I honor you.

9.verse: Do not reject me when I am old; do not leave me when my strength is gone.

10.verse: My enemies make plans against me, and they meet together to kill me.

11.verse: They say, “God has left him. Go after him and take him, because no one will save him.”

12.verse: God, don’t be far off. My God, hurry to help me.

13.verse: Let those who accuse me be ashamed and destroyed. Let those who are trying to hurt me be covered with shame and disgrace.

14.verse: But I will always have hope and will praise you more and more.

15.verse: I will tell how you do what is right. I will tell about your salvation all day long, even though it is more than I can tell.

16.verse: I will come and tell about your powerful works, Lord GOD. I will remind people that only you do what is right.

17.verse: God, you have taught me since I was young. To this day I tell about the miracles you do.

18.verse: Even though I am old and gray, do not leave me, God. I will tell the children about your power; I will tell those who live after me about your might.

19.verse: God, your justice reaches to the skies. You have done great things; God, there is no one like you.

20.verse: You have given me many troubles and bad times, but you will give me life again. When I am almost dead, you will keep me alive.

21.verse: You will make me greater than ever, and you will comfort me again.

22.verse: I will praise you with the harp. I trust you, my God. I will sing to you with the lyre, Holy One of Israel.

23.verse: I will shout for joy when I sing praises to you. You have saved me.

24.verse: I will tell about your justice all day long. And those who want to hurt me will be ashamed and disgraced.

1.verse: A Prayer for the King - Of Solomon. God, give the king your good judgment and the king’s son your goodness.

2.verse: Help him judge your people fairly and decide what is right for the poor.

3.verse: Let there be peace on the mountains and goodness on the hills for the people.

4.verse: Help him be fair to the poor and save the needy and punish those who hurt them.

5.verse: May they respect you as long as the sun shines and as long as the moon glows.

6.verse: Let him be like rain on the grass, like showers that water the earth.

7.verse: Let goodness be plentiful while he lives. Let peace continue as long as there is a moon.

8.verse: Let his kingdom go from sea to sea, and from the Euphrates River to the ends of the earth.

9.verse: Let the people of the desert bow down to him, and make his enemies lick the dust.

10.verse: Let the kings of Tarshish and the faraway lands bring him gifts. Let the kings of Sheba and Seba bring their presents to him.

11.verse: Let all kings bow down to him and all nations serve him.

12.verse: He will help the poor when they cry out and will save the needy when no one else will help.

13.verse: He will be kind to the weak and poor, and he will save their lives.

14.verse: He will save them from cruel people who try to hurt them, because their lives are precious to him.

15.verse: Long live the king! Let him receive gold from Sheba. Let people always pray for him and bless him all day long.

16.verse: Let the fields grow plenty of grain and the hills be covered with crops. Let the land be as fertile as Lebanon, and let the cities grow like the grass in a field.

17.verse: Let the king be famous forever; let him be remembered as long as the sun shines. Let the nations be blessed because of him, and may they all bless him.

18.verse: Praise the LORD God, the God of Israel, who alone does such miracles.

19.verse: Praise his glorious name forever. Let his glory fill the whole world. Amen and amen.

20.verse: This ends the prayers of David son of Jesse.

1.verse: Should the Wicked Be Rich? - A psalm of Asaph. God is truly good to Israel, to those who have pure hearts.

2.verse: But I had almost stopped believing; I had almost lost my faith

3.verse: because I was jealous of proud people. I saw wicked people doing well.

4.verse: They are not suffering; they are healthy and strong.

5.verse: They don’t have troubles like the rest of us; they don’t have problems like other people.

6.verse: They wear pride like a necklace and put on violence as their clothing.

7.verse: They are looking for profits and do not control their selfish desires.

8.verse: They make fun of others and speak evil; proudly they speak of hurting others.

9.verse: They brag to the sky. They say that they own the earth.

10.verse: So their people turn to them and give them whatever they want.

11.verse: They say, “How can God know? What does God Most High know?”

12.verse: These people are wicked, always at ease, and getting richer.

13.verse: So why have I kept my heart pure? Why have I kept my hands from doing wrong?

14.verse: I have suffered all day long; I have been punished every morning.

15.verse: God, if I had decided to talk like this, I would have let your people down.

16.verse: I tried to understand all this, but it was too hard for me to see

17.verse: until I went to the Temple of God. Then I understood what will happen to them.

18.verse: You have put them in danger; you cause them to be destroyed.

19.verse: They are destroyed in a moment; they are swept away by terrors.

20.verse: It will be like waking from a dream. Lord, when you rise up, they will disappear.

21.verse: When my heart was sad and I was angry,

22.verse: I was senseless and stupid. I acted like an animal toward you.

23.verse: But I am always with you; you have held my hand.

24.verse: You guide me with your advice, and later you will receive me in honor.

25.verse: I have no one in heaven but you; I want nothing on earth besides you.

26.verse: My body and my mind may become weak, but God is my strength. He is mine forever.

27.verse: Those who are far from God will die; you destroy those who are unfaithful.

28.verse: But I am close to God, and that is good. The Lord GOD is my protection. I will tell all that you have done.

1.verse: A Nation in Trouble Prays - A maskil of Asaph. God, why have you rejected us for so long? Why are you angry with us, the sheep of your pasture?

2.verse: Remember the people you bought long ago. You saved us, and we are your very own. After all, you live on Mount Zion.

3.verse: Make your way through these old ruins; the enemy wrecked everything in the Temple.

4.verse: Those who were against you shouted in your meeting place and raised their flags there.

5.verse: They came with axes raised as if to cut down a forest of trees.

6.verse: They smashed the carved panels with their axes and hatchets.

7.verse: They burned your Temple to the ground; they have made the place where you live unclean.

8.verse: They thought, “We will completely crush them!” They burned every place where God was worshiped in the land.

9.verse: We do not see any signs. There are no more prophets, and no one knows how long this will last.

10.verse: God, how much longer will the enemy make fun of you? Will they insult you forever?

11.verse: Why do you hold back your power? Bring your power out in the open and destroy them!

12.verse: God, you have been our king for a long time. You bring salvation to the earth.

13.verse: You split open the sea by your power and broke the heads of the sea monster.

14.verse: You smashed the heads of the monster Leviathan and gave it to the desert creatures as food.

15.verse: You opened up the springs and streams and made the flowing rivers run dry.

16.verse: Both the day and the night are yours; you made the sun and the moon.

17.verse: You set all the limits on the earth; you created summer and winter.

18.verse: LORD, remember how the enemy insulted you. Remember how those foolish people made fun of you.

19.verse: Do not give us, your doves, to those wild animals. Never forget your poor people.

20.verse: Remember the agreement you made with us, because violence fills every dark corner of this land.

21.verse: Do not let your suffering people be disgraced. Let the poor and helpless praise you.

22.verse: God, arise and defend yourself. Remember the insults that come from those foolish people all day long.

23.verse: Don’t forget what your enemies said; don’t forget their roar as they rise against you always.

1.verse: God the Judge - For the director of music. To the tune of “Do Not Destroy.” A psalm of Asaph. A song. God, we thank you; we thank you because you are near. We tell about the miracles you do.

2.verse: You say, “I set the time for trial, and I will judge fairly.

3.verse: The earth with all its people may shake, but I am the one who holds it steady. Selah

4.verse: I say to those who are proud, ‘Don’t brag,’ and to the wicked, ‘Don’t show your power.

5.verse: Don’t try to use your power against heaven. Don’t be stubborn.’”

6.verse: No one from the east or the west or the desert can judge you.

7.verse: God is the judge; he judges one person as guilty and another as innocent.

8.verse: The LORD holds a cup of anger in his hand; it is full of wine mixed with spices. He pours it out even to the last drop, and the wicked drink it all.

9.verse: I will tell about this forever; I will sing praise to the God of Jacob.

10.verse: He will take all power away from the wicked, but the power of good people will grow.

1.verse: The God Who Always Wins - For the director of music. With stringed instruments. A psalm of Asaph. A song. People in Judah know God; his fame is great in Israel.

2.verse: His Tent is in Jerusalem; his home is on Mount Zion.

3.verse: There God broke the flaming arrows, the shields, the swords, and the weapons of war. Selah

4.verse: God, how wonderful you are! You are more splendid than the hills full of animals.

5.verse: The brave soldiers were stripped as they lay asleep in death. Not one warrior had the strength to stop it.

6.verse: God of Jacob, when you spoke strongly, horses and riders fell dead.

7.verse: You are feared; no one can stand against you when you are angry.

8.verse: From heaven you gave the decision, and the earth was afraid and silent.

9.verse: God, you stood up to judge and to save the needy people of the earth. Selah

10.verse: People praise you for your anger against evil. Those who live through your anger are stopped from doing more evil.

11.verse: Make and keep your promises to the LORD your God. From all around, gifts should come to the God we worship.

12.verse: God breaks the spirits of great leaders; the kings on earth fear him.

1.verse: Remembering God’s Help - For the director of music. For Jeduthun. A psalm of Asaph. I cry out to God; I call to God, and he will hear me.

2.verse: I look for the Lord on the day of trouble. All night long I reach out my hands, but I cannot be comforted.

3.verse: When I remember God, I become upset; when I think, I become afraid. Selah

4.verse: You keep my eyes from closing. I am too upset to say anything.

5.verse: I keep thinking about the old days, the years of long ago.

6.verse: At night I remember my songs. I think and I ask myself:

7.verse: “Will the Lord reject us forever? Will he never be kind to us again?

8.verse: Is his love gone forever? Has he stopped speaking for all time?

9.verse: Has God forgotten mercy? Is he too angry to pity us?” Selah

10.verse: Then I say, “This is what makes me sad: For years the power of God Most High was with us.”

11.verse: I remember what the LORD did; I remember the miracles you did long ago.

12.verse: I think about all the things you did and consider your deeds.

13.verse: God, your ways are holy. No god is as great as our God.

14.verse: You are the God who does miracles; you have shown people your power.

15.verse: By your power you have saved your people, the descendants of Jacob and Joseph. Selah

16.verse: God, the waters saw you; they saw you and became afraid; the deep waters shook with fear.

17.verse: The clouds poured down their rain. The sky thundered. Your lightning flashed back and forth like arrows.

18.verse: Your thunder sounded in the whirlwind. Lightning lit up the world. The earth trembled and shook.

19.verse: You made a way through the sea and paths through the deep waters, but your footprints were not seen.

20.verse: You led your people like a flock by using Moses and Aaron.

1.verse: God Saved Israel from Egypt - A maskil of Asaph. My people, listen to my teaching; listen to what I say.

2.verse: I will speak using stories; I will tell secret things from long ago.

3.verse: We have heard them and known them by what our ancestors have told us.

4.verse: We will not keep them from our children; we will tell those who come later about the praises of the LORD. We will tell about his power and the miracles he has done.

5.verse: The LORD made an agreement with Jacob and gave the teachings to Israel, which he commanded our ancestors to teach to their children.

6.verse: Then their children would know them, even their children not yet born. And they would tell their children.

7.verse: So they would all trust God and would not forget what he had done but would obey his commands.

8.verse: They would not be like their ancestors who were stubborn and disobedient. Their hearts were not loyal to God, and they were not true to him.

9.verse: The men of Ephraim had bows for weapons, but they ran away on the day of battle.

10.verse: They didn’t keep their agreement with God and refused to live by his teachings.

11.verse: They forgot what he had done and the miracles he had shown them.

12.verse: He did miracles while their ancestors watched, in the fields of Zoan in Egypt.

13.verse: He divided the Red Sea and led them through. He made the water stand up like a wall.

14.verse: He led them with a cloud by day and by the light of a fire by night.

15.verse: He split the rocks in the desert and gave them more than enough water, as if from the deep ocean.

16.verse: He brought streams out of the rock and caused water to flow down like rivers.

17.verse: But the people continued to sin against him; in the desert they turned against God Most High.

18.verse: They decided to test God by asking for the food they wanted.

19.verse: Then they spoke against God, saying, “Can God prepare food in the desert?

20.verse: When he hit the rock, water poured out and rivers flowed down. But can he give us bread also? Will he provide his people with meat?”

21.verse: When the LORD heard them, he was very angry. His anger was like fire to the people of Jacob; his anger grew against the people of Israel.

22.verse: They had not believed God and had not trusted him to save them.

23.verse: But he gave a command to the clouds above and opened the doors of heaven.

24.verse: He rained manna down on them to eat; he gave them grain from heaven.

25.verse: So they ate the bread of angels. He sent them all the food they could eat.

26.verse: He sent the east wind from heaven and led the south wind by his power.

27.verse: He rained meat on them like dust. The birds were as many as the sand of the sea.

28.verse: He made the birds fall inside the camp, all around the tents.

29.verse: So the people ate and became very full. God had given them what they wanted.

30.verse: While they were still eating, and while the food was still in their mouths,

31.verse: God became angry with them. He killed some of the healthiest of them; he struck down the best young men of Israel.

32.verse: But they kept on sinning; they did not believe even with the miracles.

33.verse: So he ended their days without meaning and their years in terror.

34.verse: Anytime he killed them, they would look to him for help; they would come back to God and follow him.

35.verse: They would remember that God was their Rock, that God Most High had saved them.

36.verse: But their words were false, and their tongues lied to him.

37.verse: Their hearts were not really loyal to God; they did not keep his agreement.

38.verse: Still God was merciful. He forgave their sins and did not destroy them. Many times he held back his anger and did not stir up all his anger.

39.verse: He remembered that they were only human, like a wind that blows and does not come back.

40.verse: They turned against God so often in the desert and grieved him there.

41.verse: Again and again they tested God and brought pain to the Holy One of Israel.

42.verse: They did not remember his power or the time he saved them from the enemy.

43.verse: They forgot the signs he did in Egypt and his wonders in the fields of Zoan.

44.verse: He turned their rivers to blood so no one could drink the water.

45.verse: He sent flies that bit the people. He sent frogs that destroyed them.

46.verse: He gave their crops to grasshoppers and what they worked for to locusts.

47.verse: He destroyed their vines with hail and their sycamore trees with sleet.

48.verse: He killed their animals with hail and their cattle with lightning.

49.verse: He showed them his hot anger. He sent his strong anger against them, his destroying angels.

50.verse: He found a way to show his anger. He did not keep them from dying but let them die by a terrible disease.

51.verse: God killed all the firstborn sons in Egypt, the oldest son of each family of Ham.

52.verse: But God led his people out like sheep and he guided them like a flock through the desert.

53.verse: He led them to safety so they had nothing to fear, but their enemies drowned in the sea.

54.verse: So God brought them to his holy land, to the mountain country he took with his own power.

55.verse: He forced out the other nations, and he had his people inherit the land. He let the tribes of Israel settle there in tents.

56.verse: But they tested God and turned against God Most High; they did not keep his rules.

57.verse: They turned away and were disloyal just like their ancestors. They were like a crooked bow that does not shoot straight.

58.verse: They made God angry by building places to worship gods; they made him jealous with their idols.

59.verse: When God heard them, he became very angry and rejected the people of Israel completely.

60.verse: He left his dwelling at Shiloh, the Tent where he lived among the people.

61.verse: He let the Ark, his power, be captured; he let the Ark, his glory, be taken by enemies.

62.verse: He let his people be killed; he was very angry with his children.

63.verse: The young men died by fire, and the young women had no one to marry.

64.verse: Their priests fell by the sword, but their widows were not allowed to cry.

65.verse: Then the Lord got up as if he had been asleep; he awoke like a man who had been drunk with wine.

66.verse: He struck down his enemies and disgraced them forever.

67.verse: But God rejected the family of Joseph; he did not choose the tribe of Ephraim.

68.verse: Instead, he chose the tribe of Judah and Mount Zion, which he loves.

69.verse: And he built his Temple high like the mountains. Like the earth, he built it to last forever.

70.verse: He chose David to be his servant and took him from the sheep pens.

71.verse: He brought him from tending the sheep so he could lead the flock, the people of Jacob, his own people, the people of Israel.

72.verse: And David led them with an innocent heart and guided them with skillful hands.

1.verse: The Nation Cries for Jerusalem - A psalm of Asaph. God, nations have come against your chosen people. They have ruined your holy Temple. They have turned Jerusalem into ruins.

2.verse: They have given the bodies of your servants as food to the wild birds. They have given the bodies of those who worship you to the wild animals.

3.verse: They have spilled blood like water all around Jerusalem. No one was left to bury the dead.

4.verse: We are a joke to the other nations; they laugh and make fun of us.

5.verse: LORD, how long will this last? Will you be angry forever? How long will your jealousy burn like a fire?

6.verse: Be angry with the nations that do not know you and with the kingdoms that do not honor you.

7.verse: They have gobbled up the people of Jacob and destroyed their land.

8.verse: Don’t punish us for our past sins. Show your mercy to us soon, because we are helpless!

9.verse: God our Savior, help us so people will praise you. Save us and forgive our sins so people will honor you.

10.verse: Why should the nations say, “Where is their God?” Tell the other nations in our presence that you punish those who kill your servants.

11.verse: Hear the moans of the prisoners. Use your great power to save those sentenced to die.

12.verse: Repay those around us seven times over for their insults to you, Lord.

13.verse: We are your people, the sheep of your flock. We will thank you always; forever and ever we will praise you.

1.verse: A Prayer to Bring Israel Back - For the director of music. To the tune of “Lilies of the Agreement.” A psalm of Asaph. Shepherd of Israel, listen to us. You lead the people of Joseph like a flock. You sit on your throne between the gold creatures with wings. Show your greatness

2.verse: to the people of Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh. Use your strength, and come to save us.

3.verse: God, take us back. Show us your kindness so we can be saved.

4.verse: LORD God All-Powerful, how long will you be angry at the prayers of your people?

5.verse: You have fed your people with tears; you have made them drink many tears.

6.verse: You made those around us fight over us, and our enemies make fun of us.

7.verse: God All-Powerful, take us back. Show us your kindness so we can be saved.

8.verse: You brought us out of Egypt as if we were a vine. You forced out other nations and planted us in the land.

9.verse: You cleared the ground for us. Like a vine, we took root and filled the land.

10.verse: We covered the mountains with our shade. We had limbs like the mighty cedar tree.

11.verse: Our branches reached the Mediterranean Sea, and our shoots went to the Euphrates River.

12.verse: So why did you pull down our walls? Now everyone who passes by steals from us.

13.verse: Like wild pigs they walk over us; like wild animals they feed on us.

14.verse: God All-Powerful, come back. Look down from heaven and see. Take care of us, your vine.

15.verse: You planted this shoot with your own hands and strengthened this child.

16.verse: Now it is cut down and burned with fire; you destroyed us by your angry looks.

17.verse: With your hand, strengthen the one you have chosen for yourself.

18.verse: Then we will not turn away from you. Give us life again, and we will call to you for help.

19.verse: LORD God All-Powerful, take us back. Show us your kindness so we can be saved.

1.verse: A Song for a Holiday - For the director of music. By the gittith. A psalm of Asaph. Sing for joy to God, our strength; shout out loud to the God of Jacob.

2.verse: Begin the music. Play the tambourines. Play pleasant music on the harps and lyres.

3.verse: Blow the trumpet at the time of the New Moon, when the moon is full, when our feast begins.

4.verse: This is the law for Israel; it is the command of the God of Jacob.

5.verse: He gave this rule to the people of Joseph when they went out of the land of Egypt. I heard a language I did not know, saying:

6.verse: “I took the load off their shoulders; I let them put down their baskets.

7.verse: When you were in trouble, you called, and I saved you. I answered you with thunder. I tested you at the waters of Meribah. Selah

8.verse: My people, listen. I am warning you. Israel, please listen to me!

9.verse: You must not have foreign gods; you must not worship any false god.

10.verse: I, the LORD, am your God, who brought you out of Egypt. Open your mouth and I will feed you.

11.verse: “But my people did not listen to me; Israel did not want me.

12.verse: So I let them go their stubborn way and follow their own advice.

13.verse: I wish my people would listen to me; I wish Israel would live my way.

14.verse: Then I would quickly defeat their enemies and turn my hand against their foes.

15.verse: Those who hate the LORD would bow before him. Their punishment would continue forever.

16.verse: But I would give you the finest wheat and fill you with honey from the rocks.”

1.verse: A Cry for Justice - A psalm of Asaph. God is in charge of the great meeting; he judges among the “gods.”

2.verse: He says, “How long will you defend evil people? How long will you show greater kindness to the wicked? Selah

3.verse: Defend the weak and the orphans; defend the rights of the poor and suffering.

4.verse: Save the weak and helpless; free them from the power of the wicked.

5.verse: “You know nothing. You don’t understand. You walk in the dark, while the world is falling apart.

6.verse: I said, ‘You are “gods.” You are all sons of God Most High.’

7.verse: But you will die like any other person; you will fall like all the leaders.”

8.verse: God, come and judge the earth, because you own all the nations.

1.verse: A Prayer Against the Enemies - A song. A psalm of Asaph. God, do not keep quiet; God, do not be silent or still.

2.verse: Your enemies are making noises; those who hate you are getting ready to attack.

3.verse: They are making secret plans against your people; they plot against those you love.

4.verse: They say, “Come, let’s destroy them as a nation. Then no one will ever remember the name ‘Israel.’”

5.verse: They are united in their plan. These have made an agreement against you:

6.verse: the families of Edom and the Ishmaelites, Moab and the Hagrites,

7.verse: the people of Byblos, Ammon, Amalek, Philistia, and Tyre.

8.verse: Even Assyria has joined them to help Ammon and Moab, the descendants of Lot. Selah

9.verse: God, do to them what you did to Midian, what you did to Sisera and Jabin at the Kishon River.

10.verse: They died at Endor, and their bodies rotted on the ground.

11.verse: Do to their important leaders what you did to Oreb and Zeeb. Do to their princes what you did to Zebah and Zalmunna.

12.verse: They said, “Let’s take for ourselves the pasturelands that belong to God.”

13.verse: My God, make them like tumbleweed, like chaff blown away by the wind.

14.verse: Be like a fire that burns a forest or like flames that blaze through the hills.

15.verse: Chase them with your storm, and frighten them with your wind.

16.verse: Cover them with shame. Then people will look for you, LORD.

17.verse: Make them afraid and ashamed forever. Disgrace them and destroy them.

18.verse: Then they will know that you are the LORD, that only you are God Most High over all the earth.

1.verse: Wishing to Be in the Temple - For the director of music. On the gittith. A psalm of the sons of Korah. LORD All-Powerful, how lovely is your Temple!

2.verse: I want more than anything to be in the courtyards of the LORD’s Temple. My whole being wants to be with the living God.

3.verse: The sparrows have found a home, and the swallows have nests. They raise their young near your altars, LORD All-Powerful, my King and my God.

4.verse: Happy are the people who live at your Temple; they are always praising you. Selah

5.verse: Happy are those whose strength comes from you, who want to travel to Jerusalem.

6.verse: As they pass through the Valley of Baca, they make it like a spring. The autumn rains fill it with pools of water.

7.verse: The people get stronger as they go, and everyone meets with God in Jerusalem.

8.verse: LORD God All-Powerful, hear my prayer; God of Jacob, listen to me. Selah

9.verse: God, look at our shield; be kind to your appointed king.

10.verse: One day in the courtyards of your Temple is better than a thousand days anywhere else. I would rather be a doorkeeper in the Temple of my God than live in the homes of the wicked.

11.verse: The LORD God is like a sun and shield; the LORD gives us kindness and honor. He does not hold back anything good from those whose lives are innocent.

12.verse: LORD All-Powerful, happy are the people who trust you!

1.verse: A Prayer for the Nation - For the director of music. A psalm of the sons of Korah. LORD, you have been kind to your land; you brought back the people of Jacob.

2.verse: You forgave the guilt of the people and covered all their sins. Selah

3.verse: You stopped all your anger; you turned back from your strong anger.

4.verse: God our Savior, bring us back again. Stop being angry with us.

5.verse: Will you be angry with us forever? Will you stay angry from now on?

6.verse: Won’t you give us life again? Your people would rejoice in you.

7.verse: LORD, show us your love, and save us.

8.verse: I will listen to God the LORD. He has ordered peace for those who worship him. Don’t let them go back to foolishness.

9.verse: God will soon save those who respect him, and his glory will be seen in our land.

10.verse: Love and truth belong to God’s people; goodness and peace will be theirs.

11.verse: On earth people will be loyal to God, and God’s goodness will shine down from heaven.

12.verse: The LORD will give his goodness, and the land will give its crops.

13.verse: Goodness will go before God and prepare the way for him.

1.verse: A Cry for Help - A prayer of David. LORD, listen to me and answer me. I am poor and helpless.

2.verse: Protect me, because I worship you. My God, save me, your servant who trusts in you.

3.verse: Lord, have mercy on me, because I have called to you all day.

4.verse: Give happiness to me, your servant, because I give my life to you, Lord.

5.verse: Lord, you are kind and forgiving and have great love for those who call to you.

6.verse: LORD, hear my prayer, and listen when I ask for mercy.

7.verse: I call to you in times of trouble, because you will answer me.

8.verse: Lord, there is no god like you and no works like yours.

9.verse: Lord, all the nations you have made will come and worship you. They will honor you.

10.verse: You are great and you do miracles. Only you are God.

11.verse: LORD, teach me what you want me to do, and I will live by your truth. Teach me to respect you completely.

12.verse: Lord, my God, I will praise you with all my heart, and I will honor your name forever.

13.verse: You have great love for me. You have saved me from death.

14.verse: God, proud people are attacking me; a gang of cruel people is trying to kill me. They do not respect you.

15.verse: But, Lord, you are a God who shows mercy and is kind. You don’t become angry quickly. You have great love and faithfulness.

16.verse: Turn to me and have mercy. Give me, your servant, strength. Save me, the son of your female servant.

17.verse: Show me a sign of your goodness. When my enemies look, they will be ashamed. You, LORD, have helped me and comforted me.

1.verse: God Loves Jerusalem - A song. A psalm of the sons of Korah. The LORD built Jerusalem on the holy mountain.

2.verse: He loves its gates more than any other place in Israel.

3.verse: City of God, wonderful things are said about you. Selah

4.verse: God says, “I will put Egypt and Babylonia on the list of nations that know me. People from Philistia, Tyre, and Cush will be born there.”

5.verse: They will say about Jerusalem, “This one and that one were born there. God Most High will strengthen her.”

6.verse: The LORD will keep a list of the nations. He will note, “This person was born there.” Selah

7.verse: They will dance and sing, “All good things come from Jerusalem.”

1.verse: A Sad Complaint - A song. A psalm of the sons of Korah. For the director of music. By the mahalath leannoth. A maskil of Heman the Ezrahite. LORD, you are the God who saves me. I cry out to you day and night.

2.verse: Receive my prayer, and listen to my cry.

3.verse: My life is full of troubles, and I am nearly dead.

4.verse: They think I am on the way to my grave. I am like a man with no strength.

5.verse: I have been left as dead, like a body lying in a grave whom you don’t remember anymore, cut off from your care.

6.verse: You have brought me close to death; I am almost in the dark place of the dead.

7.verse: You have been very angry with me; all your waves crush me. Selah

8.verse: You have taken my friends away from me and have made them hate me. I am trapped and cannot escape.

9.verse: My eyes are weak from crying. LORD, I have prayed to you every day; I have lifted my hands in prayer to you.

10.verse: Do you show your miracles for the dead? Do their spirits rise up and praise you? Selah

11.verse: Will your love be told in the grave? Will your loyalty be told in the place of death?

12.verse: Will your miracles be known in the dark grave? Will your goodness be known in the land of forgetfulness?

13.verse: But, LORD, I have called out to you for help; every morning I pray to you.

14.verse: LORD, why do you reject me? Why do you hide from me?

15.verse: I have been weak and dying since I was young. I suffer from your terrors, and I am helpless.

16.verse: You have been angry with me, and your terrors have destroyed me.

17.verse: They surround me daily like a flood; they are all around me.

18.verse: You have taken away my loved ones and friends. Darkness is my only friend.

1.verse: A Song About God’s Loyalty - A maskil of Ethan the Ezrahite. I will always sing about the LORD’s love; I will tell of his loyalty from now on.

2.verse: I will say, “Your love continues forever; your loyalty goes on and on like the sky.”

3.verse: You said, “I made an agreement with the man of my choice; I made a promise to my servant David.

4.verse: I told him, ‘I will make your family continue forever. Your kingdom will go on and on.’” Selah

5.verse: LORD, the heavens praise you for your miracles and for your loyalty in the meeting of your holy ones.

6.verse: Who in heaven is equal to the LORD? None of the angels is like the LORD.

7.verse: When the holy ones meet, it is God they fear. He is more frightening than all who surround him.

8.verse: LORD God All-Powerful, who is like you? LORD, you are powerful and completely trustworthy.

9.verse: You rule the mighty sea and calm the stormy waves.

10.verse: You crushed the sea monster Rahab; by your power you scattered your enemies.

11.verse: The skies and the earth belong to you. You made the world and everything in it.

12.verse: You created the north and the south. Mount Tabor and Mount Hermon sing for joy at your name.

13.verse: Your arm has great power. Your hand is strong; your right hand is lifted up.

14.verse: Your kingdom is built on what is right and fair. Love and truth are in all you do.

15.verse: Happy are the people who know how to praise you. LORD, let them live in the light of your presence.

16.verse: In your name they rejoice and continually praise your goodness.

17.verse: You are their glorious strength, and in your kindness you honor our king.

18.verse: Our king, our shield, belongs to the LORD, to the Holy One of Israel.

19.verse: Once, in a vision, you spoke to those who worship you. You said, “I have given strength to a warrior; I have raised up a young man from my people.

20.verse: I have found my servant David; I appointed him by pouring holy oil on him.

21.verse: I will steady him with my hand and strengthen him with my arm.

22.verse: No enemy will make him give forced payments, and wicked people will not defeat him.

23.verse: I will crush his enemies in front of him; I will defeat those who hate him.

24.verse: My loyalty and love will be with him. Through me he will be strong.

25.verse: I will give him power over the sea and control over the rivers.

26.verse: He will say to me, ‘You are my father, my God, the Rock, my Savior.’

27.verse: I will make him my firstborn son, the greatest king on earth.

28.verse: My love will watch over him forever, and my agreement with him will never end.

29.verse: I will make his family continue, and his kingdom will last as long as the skies.

30.verse: “If his descendants reject my teachings and do not follow my laws,

31.verse: if they ignore my demands and disobey my commands,

32.verse: then I will punish their sins with a rod and their wrongs with a whip.

33.verse: But I will not hold back my love from David, nor will I stop being loyal.

34.verse: I will not break my agreement nor change what I have said.

35.verse: I have promised by my holiness, I will not lie to David.

36.verse: His family will go on forever. His kingdom will last before me like the sun.

37.verse: It will continue forever, like the moon, like a dependable witness in the sky.” Selah

38.verse: But now you have refused and rejected your appointed king. You have been angry with him.

39.verse: You have abandoned the agreement with your servant and thrown his crown to the ground.

40.verse: You have torn down all his city walls; you have turned his strong cities into ruins.

41.verse: Everyone who passes by steals from him. His neighbors insult him.

42.verse: You have given strength to his enemies and have made them all happy.

43.verse: You have made his sword useless; you did not help him stand in battle.

44.verse: You have kept him from winning and have thrown his throne to the ground.

45.verse: You have cut his life short and covered him with shame. Selah

46.verse: LORD, how long will this go on? Will you ignore us forever? How long will your anger burn like a fire?

47.verse: Remember how short my life is. Why did you create us? For nothing?

48.verse: What person alive will not die? Who can escape the grave? Selah

49.verse: Lord, where is your love from times past, which in your loyalty you promised to David?

50.verse: Lord, remember how they insulted your servant; remember how I have suffered the insults of the nations.

51.verse: LORD, remember how your enemies insulted you and how they insulted your appointed king wherever he went.

52.verse: Praise the LORD forever! Amen and amen.

1.verse: God Is Eternal, and We Are Not - A prayer of Moses, the man of God. Lord, you have been our home since the beginning.

2.verse: Before the mountains were born and before you created the earth and the world, you are God. You have always been, and you will always be.

3.verse: You turn people back into dust. You say, “Go back into dust, human beings.”

4.verse: To you, a thousand years is like the passing of a day, or like a few hours in the night.

5.verse: While people sleep, you take their lives. They are like grass that grows up in the morning.

6.verse: In the morning they are fresh and new, but by evening they dry up and die.

7.verse: We are destroyed by your anger; we are terrified by your hot anger.

8.verse: You have put the evil we have done right in front of you; you clearly see our secret sins.

9.verse: All our days pass while you are angry. Our years end with a moan.

10.verse: Our lifetime is seventy years or, if we are strong, eighty years. But the years are full of hard work and pain. They pass quickly, and then we are gone.

11.verse: Who knows the full power of your anger? Your anger is as great as our fear of you should be.

12.verse: Teach us how short our lives really are so that we may be wise.

13.verse: LORD, how long before you return and show kindness to your servants?

14.verse: Fill us with your love every morning. Then we will sing and rejoice all our lives.

15.verse: We have seen years of trouble. Now give us as much joy as you gave us sorrow.

16.verse: Show your servants the wonderful things you do; show your greatness to their children.

17.verse: Lord our God, treat us well. Give us success in what we do; yes, give us success in what we do.

1.verse: Safe in the LORD - Those who go to God Most High for safety will be protected by the Almighty.

2.verse: I will say to the LORD, “You are my place of safety and protection. You are my God and I trust you.”

3.verse: God will save you from hidden traps and from deadly diseases.

4.verse: He will cover you with his feathers, and under his wings you can hide. His truth will be your shield and protection.

5.verse: You will not fear any danger by night or an arrow during the day.

6.verse: You will not be afraid of diseases that come in the dark or sickness that strikes at noon.

7.verse: At your side one thousand people may die, or even ten thousand right beside you, but you will not be hurt.

8.verse: You will only watch and see the wicked punished.

9.verse: The LORD is your protection; you have made God Most High your place of safety.

10.verse: Nothing bad will happen to you; no disaster will come to your home.

11.verse: He has put his angels in charge of you to watch over you wherever you go.

12.verse: They will catch you in their hands so that you will not hit your foot on a rock.

13.verse: You will walk on lions and cobras; you will step on strong lions and snakes.

14.verse: The LORD says, “Whoever loves me, I will save. I will protect those who know me.

15.verse: They will call to me, and I will answer them. I will be with them in trouble; I will rescue them and honor them.

16.verse: I will give them a long, full life, and they will see how I can save.”

1.verse: Thanksgiving for God’s Goodness - A psalm. A song for the Sabbath day. It is good to praise you, LORD, to sing praises to God Most High.

2.verse: It is good to tell of your love in the morning and of your loyalty at night.

3.verse: It is good to praise you with the ten-stringed lyre and with the soft-sounding harp.

4.verse: LORD, you have made me happy by what you have done; I will sing for joy about what your hands have done.

5.verse: LORD, you have done such great things! How deep are your thoughts!

6.verse: Stupid people don’t know these things, and fools don’t understand.

7.verse: Wicked people grow like the grass. Evil people seem to do well, but they will be destroyed forever.

8.verse: But, LORD, you will be honored forever.

9.verse: LORD, surely your enemies, surely your enemies will be destroyed, and all who do evil will be scattered.

10.verse: But you have made me as strong as an ox. You have poured fine oils on me.

11.verse: When I looked, I saw my enemies; I heard the cries of those who are against me.

12.verse: But good people will grow like palm trees; they will be tall like the cedars of Lebanon.

13.verse: Like trees planted in the Temple of the LORD, they will grow strong in the courtyards of our God.

14.verse: When they are old, they will still produce fruit; they will be healthy and fresh.

15.verse: They will say that the LORD is good. He is my Rock, and there is no wrong in him.

1.verse: The Majesty of the LORD - The LORD is king. He is clothed in majesty. The LORD is clothed in majesty and armed with strength. The world is set, and it cannot be moved.

2.verse: LORD, your kingdom was set up long ago; you are everlasting.

3.verse: LORD, the seas raise, the seas raise their voice. The seas raise up their pounding waves.

4.verse: The sound of the water is loud; the ocean waves are powerful, but the LORD above is much greater.

5.verse: LORD, your laws will stand forever. Your Temple will be holy forevermore.

1.verse: God Will Pay Back His Enemies - The LORD is a God who punishes. God, show your greatness and punish!

2.verse: Rise up, Judge of the earth, and give the proud what they deserve.

3.verse: How long will the wicked be happy? How long, LORD?

4.verse: They are full of proud words; those who do evil brag about what they have done.

5.verse: LORD, they crush your people and make your children suffer.

6.verse: They kill widows and foreigners and murder orphans.

7.verse: They say, “The LORD doesn’t see; the God of Jacob doesn’t notice.”

8.verse: You stupid ones among the people, pay attention. You fools, when will you understand?

9.verse: Can’t the creator of ears hear? Can’t the maker of eyes see?

10.verse: Won’t the one who corrects nations punish you? Doesn’t the teacher of people know everything?

11.verse: The LORD knows what people think. He knows their thoughts are just a puff of wind.

12.verse: LORD, those you correct are happy; you teach them from your law.

13.verse: You give them rest from times of trouble until a pit is dug for the wicked.

14.verse: The LORD won’t leave his people nor give up his children.

15.verse: Judgment will again be fair, and all who are honest will follow it.

16.verse: Who will help me fight against the wicked? Who will stand with me against those who do evil?

17.verse: If the LORD had not helped me, I would have died in a minute.

18.verse: I said, “I am about to fall,” but, LORD, your love kept me safe.

19.verse: I was very worried, but you comforted me and made me happy.

20.verse: Crooked leaders cannot be your friends. They use the law to cause suffering.

21.verse: They join forces against people who do right and sentence to death the innocent.

22.verse: But the LORD is my defender; my God is the rock of my protection.

23.verse: God will pay them back for their sins and will destroy them for their evil. The LORD our God will destroy them.

1.verse: A Call to Praise and Obedience - Come, let’s sing for joy to the LORD. Let’s shout praises to the Rock who saves us.

2.verse: Let’s come to him with thanksgiving. Let’s sing songs to him,

3.verse: because the LORD is the great God, the great King over all gods.

4.verse: The deepest places on earth are his, and the highest mountains belong to him.

5.verse: The sea is his because he made it, and he created the land with his own hands.

6.verse: Come, let’s worship him and bow down. Let’s kneel before the LORD who made us,

7.verse: because he is our God and we are the people he takes care of, the sheep that he tends. Today listen to what he says:

8.verse: “Do not be stubborn, as your ancestors were at Meribah, as they were that day at Massah in the desert.

9.verse: There your ancestors tested me and tried me even though they saw what I did.

10.verse: I was angry with those people for forty years. I said, ‘They are not loyal to me and have not understood my ways.’

11.verse: I was angry and made a promise, ‘They will never enter my rest.’”

1.verse: Praise for the Lord’s Glory - Sing to the LORD a new song; sing to the LORD, all the earth.

2.verse: Sing to the LORD and praise his name; every day tell how he saves us.

3.verse: Tell the nations of his glory; tell all peoples the miracles he does,

4.verse: because the LORD is great; he should be praised at all times. He should be honored more than all the gods,

5.verse: because all the gods of the nations are only idols, but the LORD made the heavens.

6.verse: The LORD has glory and majesty; he has power and beauty in his Temple.

7.verse: Praise the LORD, all nations on earth; praise the LORD’s glory and power.

8.verse: Praise the glory of the LORD’s name. Bring an offering and come into his Temple courtyards.

9.verse: Worship the LORD because he is holy. Tremble before him, everyone on earth.

10.verse: Tell the nations, “The LORD is king.” The earth is set, and it cannot be moved. He will judge the people fairly.

11.verse: Let the skies rejoice and the earth be glad; let the sea and everything in it shout.

12.verse: Let the fields and everything in them rejoice. Then all the trees of the forest will sing for joy

13.verse: before the LORD, because he is coming. He is coming to judge the world; he will judge the world with fairness and the peoples with truth.

1.verse: A Hymn About the Lord’s Power - The LORD is king. Let the earth rejoice; faraway lands should be glad.

2.verse: Thick, dark clouds surround him. His kingdom is built on what is right and fair.

3.verse: A fire goes before him and burns up his enemies all around.

4.verse: His lightning lights up the world; when the people see it, they tremble.

5.verse: The mountains melt like wax before the LORD, before the Lord of all the earth.

6.verse: The heavens tell about his goodness, and all the people see his glory.

7.verse: Those who worship idols should be ashamed; they brag about their gods. All the gods should worship the LORD.

8.verse: When Jerusalem hears this, she is glad, and the towns of Judah rejoice. They are happy because of your judgments, LORD.

9.verse: You are the LORD Most High over all the earth; you are supreme over all gods.

10.verse: People who love the LORD hate evil. The LORD watches over those who follow him and frees them from the power of the wicked.

11.verse: Light shines on those who do right; joy belongs to those who are honest.

12.verse: Rejoice in the LORD, you who do right. Praise his holy name.

1.verse: The Lord of Power and Justice - A psalm. Sing to the LORD a new song, because he has done miracles. By his right hand and holy arm he has won the victory.

2.verse: The LORD has made known his power to save; he has shown the other nations his victory for his people.

3.verse: He has remembered his love and his loyalty to the people of Israel. All the ends of the earth have seen God’s power to save.

4.verse: Shout with joy to the LORD, all the earth; burst into songs and make music.

5.verse: Make music to the LORD with harps, with harps and the sound of singing.

6.verse: Blow the trumpets and the sheep’s horns; shout for joy to the LORD the King.

7.verse: Let the sea and everything in it shout; let the world and everyone in it sing.

8.verse: Let the rivers clap their hands; let the mountains sing together for joy.

9.verse: Let them sing before the LORD, because he is coming to judge the world. He will judge the world fairly; he will judge the peoples with fairness.

1.verse: The LORD, the Fair and Holy King - The LORD is king. Let the peoples shake with fear. He sits between the gold creatures with wings. Let the earth shake.

2.verse: The LORD in Jerusalem is great; he is supreme over all the peoples.

3.verse: Let them praise your name; it is great, holy and to be feared.

4.verse: The King is powerful and loves justice. LORD, you made things fair; you have done what is fair and right for the people of Jacob.

5.verse: Praise the LORD our God, and worship at the Temple, his footstool. He is holy.

6.verse: Moses and Aaron were among his priests, and Samuel was among his worshipers. They called to the LORD, and he answered them.

7.verse: He spoke to them from the pillar of cloud. They kept the rules and laws he gave them.

8.verse: LORD our God, you answered them. You showed them that you are a forgiving God, but you punished them for their wrongs.

9.verse: Praise the LORD our God, and worship at his holy mountain, because the LORD our God is holy.

1.verse: A Call to Praise the Lord - A psalm of thanks. Shout to the LORD, all the earth.

2.verse: Serve the LORD with joy; come before him with singing.

3.verse: Know that the LORD is God. He made us, and we belong to him; we are his people, the sheep he tends.

4.verse: Come into his city with songs of thanksgiving and into his courtyards with songs of praise. Thank him and praise his name.

5.verse: The LORD is good. His love is forever, and his loyalty goes on and on.

1.verse: A Promise to Rule Well - A psalm of David. I will sing of your love and fairness; LORD, I will sing praises to you.

2.verse: I will be careful to live an innocent life. When will you come to me? I will live an innocent life in my house.

3.verse: I will not look at anything wicked. I hate those who turn against you; they will not be found near me.

4.verse: Let those who want to do wrong stay away from me; I will have nothing to do with evil.

5.verse: If anyone secretly says things against his neighbor, I will stop him. I will not allow people to be proud and look down on others.

6.verse: I will look for trustworthy people so I can live with them in the land. Only those who live innocent lives will be my servants.

7.verse: No one who is dishonest will live in my house; no liars will stay around me.

8.verse: Every morning I will destroy the wicked in the land. I will rid the LORD’s city of people who do evil.

1.verse: A Cry for Help - A prayer of a person who is suffering when he is discouraged and tells the LORD his complaints. LORD, listen to my prayer; let my cry for help come to you.

2.verse: Do not hide from me in my time of trouble. Pay attention to me. When I cry for help, answer me quickly.

3.verse: My life is passing away like smoke, and my bones are burned up with fire.

4.verse: My heart is like grass that has been cut and dried. I forget to eat.

5.verse: Because of my grief, my skin hangs on my bones.

6.verse: I am like a desert owl, like an owl living among the ruins.

7.verse: I lie awake. I am like a lonely bird on a housetop.

8.verse: All day long enemies insult me; those who make fun of me use my name as a curse.

9.verse: I eat ashes for food, and my tears fall into my drinks.

10.verse: Because of your great anger, you have picked me up and thrown me away.

11.verse: My days are like a passing shadow; I am like dried grass.

12.verse: But, LORD, you rule forever, and your fame goes on and on.

13.verse: You will come and have mercy on Jerusalem, because the time has now come to be kind to her; the right time has come.

14.verse: Your servants love even her stones; they even care about her dust.

15.verse: Nations will fear the name of the LORD, and all the kings on earth will honor you.

16.verse: The LORD will rebuild Jerusalem; there his glory will be seen.

17.verse: He will answer the prayers of the needy; he will not reject their prayers.

18.verse: Write these things for the future so that people who are not yet born will praise the LORD.

19.verse: The LORD looked down from his holy place above; from heaven he looked down at the earth.
