20.verse: He heard the moans of the prisoners, and he freed those sentenced to die.

21.verse: The name of the LORD will be heard in Jerusalem; his praise will be heard there.

22.verse: People will come together, and kingdoms will serve the LORD.

23.verse: God has made me tired of living; he has cut short my life.

24.verse: So I said, “My God, do not take me in the middle of my life. Your years go on and on.

25.verse: In the beginning you made the earth, and your hands made the skies.

26.verse: They will be destroyed, but you will remain. They will all wear out like clothes. And, like clothes, you will change them and throw them away.

27.verse: But you never change, and your life will never end.

28.verse: Our children will live in your presence, and their children will remain with you.”

1.verse: Praise to the Lord of Love - Of David. All that I am, praise the LORD; everything in me, praise his holy name.

2.verse: My whole being, praise the LORD and do not forget all his kindnesses.

3.verse: He forgives all my sins and heals all my diseases.

4.verse: He saves my life from the grave and loads me with love and mercy.

5.verse: He satisfies me with good things and makes me young again, like the eagle.

6.verse: The LORD does what is right and fair for all who are wronged by others.

7.verse: He showed his ways to Moses and his deeds to the people of Israel.

8.verse: The LORD shows mercy and is kind. He does not become angry quickly, and he has great love.

9.verse: He will not always accuse us, and he will not be angry forever.

10.verse: He has not punished us as our sins should be punished; he has not repaid us for the evil we have done.

11.verse: As high as the sky is above the earth, so great is his love for those who respect him.

12.verse: He has taken our sins away from us as far as the east is from west.

13.verse: The LORD has mercy on those who respect him, as a father has mercy on his children.

14.verse: He knows how we were made; he remembers that we are dust.

15.verse: Human life is like grass; we grow like a flower in the field.

16.verse: After the wind blows, the flower is gone, and there is no sign of where it was.

17.verse: But the LORD’s love for those who respect him continues forever and ever, and his goodness continues to their grandchildren

18.verse: and to those who keep his agreement and who remember to obey his orders.

19.verse: The LORD has set his throne in heaven, and his kingdom rules over everything.

20.verse: You who are his angels, praise the LORD. You are the mighty warriors who do what he says and who obey his voice.

21.verse: You, his armies, praise the LORD; you are his servants who do what he wants.

22.verse: Everything the LORD has made should praise him in all the places he rules. My whole being, praise the LORD.

1.verse: Praise to God Who Made the World - My whole being, praise the LORD. LORD my God, you are very great. You are clothed with glory and majesty;

2.verse: you wear light like a robe. You stretch out the skies like a tent.

3.verse: You build your room above the clouds. You make the clouds your chariot, and you ride on the wings of the wind.

4.verse: You make the winds your messengers, and flames of fire are your servants.

5.verse: You built the earth on its foundations so it can never be moved.

6.verse: You covered the earth with oceans; the water was above the mountains.

7.verse: But at your command, the water rushed away. When you thundered your orders, it hurried away.

8.verse: The mountains rose; the valleys sank. The water went to the places you made for it.

9.verse: You set borders for the seas that they cannot cross, so water will never cover the earth again.

10.verse: You make springs pour into the ravines; they flow between the mountains.

11.verse: They water all the wild animals; the wild donkeys come there to drink.

12.verse: Wild birds make nests by the water; they sing among the tree branches.

13.verse: You water the mountains from above. The earth is full of the things you made.

14.verse: You make the grass for cattle and vegetables for the people. You make food grow from the earth.

15.verse: You give us wine that makes happy hearts and olive oil that makes our faces shine. You give us bread that gives us strength.

16.verse: The LORD’s trees have plenty of water; they are the cedars of Lebanon, which he planted.

17.verse: The birds make their nests there; the stork’s home is in the fir trees.

18.verse: The high mountains belong to the wild goats. The rocks are hiding places for the badgers.

19.verse: You made the moon to mark the seasons, and the sun always knows when to set.

20.verse: You make it dark, and it becomes night. Then all the wild animals creep around.

21.verse: The lions roar as they attack. They look to God for food.

22.verse: When the sun rises, they leave and go back to their dens to lie down.

23.verse: Then people go to work and work until evening.

24.verse: LORD, you have made many things; with your wisdom you made them all. The earth is full of your riches.

25.verse: Look at the sea, so big and wide, with creatures large and small that cannot be counted.

26.verse: Ships travel over the ocean, and there is the sea monster Leviathan, which you made to play there.

27.verse: All these things depend on you to give them their food at the right time.

28.verse: When you give it to them, they gather it up. When you open your hand, they are filled with good food.

29.verse: When you turn away from them, they become frightened. When you take away their breath, they die and turn to dust.

30.verse: When you breathe on them, they are created, and you make the land new again.

31.verse: May the glory of the LORD be forever. May the LORD enjoy what he has made.

32.verse: He just looks at the earth, and it shakes. He touches the mountains, and they smoke.

33.verse: I will sing to the LORD all my life; I will sing praises to my God as long as I live.

34.verse: May my thoughts please him; I am happy in the LORD.

35.verse: Let sinners be destroyed from the earth, and let the wicked live no longer. My whole being, praise the LORD. Praise the LORD.

1.verse: God’s Love for Israel - Give thanks to the LORD and pray to him. Tell the nations what he has done.

2.verse: Sing to him; sing praises to him. Tell about all his miracles.

3.verse: Be glad that you are his; let those who seek the LORD be happy.

4.verse: Depend on the LORD and his strength; always go to him for help.

5.verse: Remember the miracles he has done; remember his wonders and his decisions.

6.verse: You are descendants of his servant Abraham, the children of Jacob, his chosen people.

7.verse: He is the LORD our God. His laws are for all the world.

8.verse: He will keep his agreement forever; he will keep his promises always.

9.verse: He will keep the agreement he made with Abraham and the promise he made to Isaac.

10.verse: He made it a law for the people of Jacob; he made it an agreement with Israel to last forever.

11.verse: The LORD said, “I will give you the land of Canaan, and it will belong to you.”

12.verse: Then God’s people were few in number. They were strangers in the land.

13.verse: They went from one nation to another, from one kingdom to another.

14.verse: But the LORD did not let anyone hurt them; he warned kings not to harm them.

15.verse: He said, “Don’t touch my chosen people, and don’t harm my prophets.”

16.verse: God ordered a time of hunger in the land, and he destroyed all the food.

17.verse: Then he sent a man ahead of them— Joseph, who was sold as a slave.

18.verse: They put chains around his feet and an iron ring around his neck.

19.verse: Then the time he had spoken of came, and the LORD’s words proved that Joseph was right.

20.verse: The king of Egypt sent for Joseph and freed him; the ruler of the people set him free.

21.verse: He made him the master of his house; Joseph was in charge of his riches.

22.verse: He could order the princes as he wished. He taught the older men to be wise.

23.verse: Then his father Israel came to Egypt; Jacob lived in Egypt.

24.verse: The LORD made his people grow in number, and he made them stronger than their enemies.

25.verse: He caused the Egyptians to hate his people and to make plans against his servants.

26.verse: Then he sent his servant Moses, and Aaron, whom he had chosen.

27.verse: They did many signs among the Egyptians and worked wonders in Egypt.

28.verse: The LORD sent darkness and made the land dark, but the Egyptians turned against what he said.

29.verse: So he changed their water into blood and made their fish die.

30.verse: Then their country was filled with frogs, even in the bedrooms of their rulers.

31.verse: The LORD spoke and flies came, and gnats were everywhere in the country.

32.verse: He made hail fall like rain and sent lightning through their land.

33.verse: He struck down their grapevines and fig trees, and he destroyed every tree in the country.

34.verse: He spoke and grasshoppers came; the locusts were too many to count.

35.verse: They ate all the plants in the land and everything the earth produced.

36.verse: The LORD also killed all the firstborn sons in the land, the oldest son of each family.

37.verse: Then he brought his people out, and they carried with them silver and gold. Not one of his people stumbled.

38.verse: The Egyptians were glad when they left, because the Egyptians were afraid of them.

39.verse: The LORD covered them with a cloud and lit up the night with fire.

40.verse: When they asked, he brought them quail and filled them with bread from heaven.

41.verse: God split the rock, and water flowed out; it ran like a river through the desert.

42.verse: He remembered his holy promise to his servant Abraham.

43.verse: So God brought his people out with joy, his chosen ones with singing.

44.verse: He gave them lands of other nations, so they received what others had worked for.

45.verse: This was so they would keep his orders and obey his teachings. Praise the LORD!

1.verse: Israel’s Failure to Trust God - Praise the LORD! Thank the LORD because he is good. His love continues forever.

2.verse: No one can tell all the mighty things the LORD has done; no one can speak all his praise.

3.verse: Happy are those who do right, who do what is fair at all times.

4.verse: LORD, remember me when you are kind to your people; help me when you save them.

5.verse: Let me see the good things you do for your chosen people. Let me be happy along with your happy nation; let me join your own people in praising you.

6.verse: We have sinned just as our ancestors did. We have done wrong; we have done evil.

7.verse: Our ancestors in Egypt did not learn from your miracles. They did not remember all your kindnesses, so they turned against you at the Red Sea.

8.verse: But the LORD saved them for his own sake, to show his great power.

9.verse: He commanded the Red Sea, and it dried up. He led them through the deep sea as if it were a desert.

10.verse: He saved them from those who hated them. He saved them from their enemies,

11.verse: and the water covered their foes. Not one of them escaped.

12.verse: Then the people believed what the LORD said, and they sang praises to him.

13.verse: But they quickly forgot what he had done; they did not wait for his advice.

14.verse: They became greedy for food in the desert, and they tested God there.

15.verse: So he gave them what they wanted, but he also sent a terrible disease among them.

16.verse: The people in the camp were jealous of Moses and of Aaron, the holy priest of the LORD.

17.verse: Then the ground opened up and swallowed Dathan and closed over Abiram’s group.

18.verse: A fire burned among their followers, and flames burned up the wicked.

19.verse: The people made a gold calf at Mount Sinai and worshiped a metal statue.

20.verse: They exchanged their glorious God for a statue of a bull that eats grass.

21.verse: They forgot the God who saved them, who had done great things in Egypt,

22.verse: who had done miracles in Egypt and amazing things by the Red Sea.

23.verse: So God said he would destroy them. But Moses, his chosen one, stood before him and stopped God’s anger from destroying them.

24.verse: Then they refused to go into the beautiful land of Canaan; they did not believe what God promised.

25.verse: They grumbled in their tents and did not obey the LORD.

26.verse: So he swore to them that they would die in the desert.

27.verse: He said their children would be killed by other nations and that they would be scattered among other countries.

28.verse: They joined in worshiping Baal at Peor and ate meat that had been sacrificed to lifeless statues.

29.verse: They made the LORD angry by what they did, so many people became sick with a terrible disease.

30.verse: But Phinehas prayed to the LORD, and the disease stopped.

31.verse: Phinehas did what was right, and it will be remembered from now on.

32.verse: The people also made the LORD angry at Meribah, and Moses was in trouble because of them.

33.verse: The people turned against the Spirit of God, so Moses spoke without stopping to think.

34.verse: The people did not destroy the other nations as the LORD had told them to do.

35.verse: Instead, they mixed with the other nations and learned their customs.

36.verse: They worshiped other nations’ idols and were trapped by them.

37.verse: They even killed their sons and daughters as sacrifices to demons.

38.verse: They killed innocent people, their own sons and daughters, as sacrifices to the idols of Canaan. So the land was made unholy by their blood.

39.verse: The people became unholy by their sins; they were unfaithful to God in what they did.

40.verse: So the LORD became angry with his people and hated his own children.

41.verse: He handed them over to other nations and let their enemies rule over them.

42.verse: Their enemies were cruel to them and kept them under their power.

43.verse: The LORD saved his people many times, but they continued to turn against him. So they became even more wicked.

44.verse: But God saw their misery when he heard their cry.

45.verse: He remembered his agreement with them, and he felt sorry for them because of his great love.

46.verse: He caused them to be pitied by those who held them captive.

47.verse: LORD our God, save us and bring us back from other nations. Then we will thank you and will gladly praise you.

48.verse: Praise the LORD, the God of Israel. He always was and always will be. Let all the people say, “Amen!” Praise the LORD!

1.verse: God Saves from Many Dangers - Thank the LORD because he is good. His love continues forever.

2.verse: That is what those whom the LORD has saved should say. He has saved them from the enemy

3.verse: and has gathered them from other lands, from east and west, north and south.

4.verse: Some people had wandered in the desert lands. They found no city in which to live.

5.verse: They were hungry and thirsty, and they were discouraged.

6.verse: In their misery they cried out to the LORD, and he saved them from their troubles.

7.verse: He led them on a straight road to a city where they could live.

8.verse: Let them give thanks to the LORD for his love and for the miracles he does for people.

9.verse: He satisfies the thirsty and fills up the hungry.

10.verse: Some sat in gloom and darkness; they were prisoners suffering in chains.

11.verse: They had turned against the words of God and had refused the advice of God Most High.

12.verse: So he broke their pride by hard work. They stumbled, and no one helped.

13.verse: In their misery they cried out to the LORD, and he saved them from their troubles.

14.verse: He brought them out of their gloom and darkness and broke their chains.

15.verse: Let them give thanks to the LORD for his love and for the miracles he does for people.

16.verse: He breaks down bronze gates and cuts apart iron bars.

17.verse: Some fools turned against God and suffered for the evil they did.

18.verse: They refused to eat anything, so they almost died.

19.verse: In their misery they cried out to the LORD, and he saved them from their troubles.

20.verse: God gave the command and healed them, so they were saved from dying.

21.verse: Let them give thanks to the LORD for his love and for the miracles he does for people.

22.verse: Let them offer sacrifices to thank him. With joy they should tell what he has done.

23.verse: Others went out to sea in ships and did business on the great oceans.

24.verse: They saw what the LORD could do, the miracles he did in the deep oceans.

25.verse: He spoke, and a storm came up, which blew up high waves.

26.verse: The ships were tossed as high as the sky and fell low to the depths. The storm was so bad that they lost their courage.

27.verse: They stumbled and fell like people who were drunk. They did not know what to do.

28.verse: In their misery they cried out to the LORD, and he saved them from their troubles.

29.verse: He stilled the storm and calmed the waves.

30.verse: They were happy that it was quiet, and God guided them to the port they wanted.

31.verse: Let them give thanks to the LORD for his love and for the miracles he does for people.

32.verse: Let them praise his greatness in the meeting of the people; let them praise him in the meeting of the elders.

33.verse: He changed rivers into a desert and springs of water into dry ground.

34.verse: He made fertile land salty, because the people there did evil.

35.verse: He changed the desert into pools of water and dry ground into springs of water.

36.verse: He had the hungry settle there so they could build a city in which to live.

37.verse: They planted seeds in the fields and vineyards, and they had a good harvest.

38.verse: God blessed them, and they grew in number. Their cattle did not become fewer.

39.verse: Because of disaster, troubles, and sadness, their families grew smaller and weaker.

40.verse: He showed he was displeased with their leaders and made them wander in a pathless desert.

41.verse: But he lifted the poor out of their suffering and made their families grow like flocks of sheep.

42.verse: Good people see this and are happy, but the wicked say nothing.

43.verse: Whoever is wise will remember these things and will think about the love of the LORD.

1.verse: A Prayer for Victory - A song. A psalm of David. God, my heart is steady. I will sing and praise you with all my being.

2.verse: Wake up, harp and lyre! I will wake up the dawn.

3.verse: LORD, I will praise you among the nations; I will sing songs of praise about you to all the nations.

4.verse: Your great love reaches to the skies, your truth to the heavens.

5.verse: God, you are supreme above the skies. Let your glory be over all the earth.

6.verse: Answer us and save us by your power so the people you love will be rescued.

7.verse: God has said from his Temple, “When I win, I will divide Shechem and measure off the Valley of Succoth.

8.verse: Gilead and Manasseh are mine. Ephraim is like my helmet. Judah holds my royal scepter.

9.verse: Moab is like my washbowl. I throw my sandals at Edom. I shout at Philistia.”

10.verse: Who will bring me to the strong, walled city? Who will lead me to Edom?

11.verse: God, surely you have rejected us; you do not go out with our armies.

12.verse: Help us fight the enemy. Human help is useless,

13.verse: but we can win with God’s help. He will defeat our enemies.

1.verse: A Prayer Against an Enemy - For the director of music. A psalm of David. God, I praise you. Do not be silent.

2.verse: Wicked people and liars have spoken against me; they have told lies about me.

3.verse: They have said hateful things about me and attack me for no reason.

4.verse: They attacked me, even though I loved them and prayed for them.

5.verse: I was good to them, but they repay me with evil. I loved them, but they hate me in return.

6.verse: They say about me, “Have an evil person work against him, and let an accuser stand against him.

7.verse: When he is judged, let him be found guilty, and let even his prayers show his guilt.

8.verse: Let his life be cut short, and let another man replace him as leader.

9.verse: Let his children become orphans and his wife a widow.

10.verse: Make his children wander around, begging for food. Let them be forced out of the ruins in which they live.

11.verse: Let the people to whom he owes money take everything he owns, and let strangers steal everything he has worked for.

12.verse: Let no one show him love or have mercy on his orphaned children.

13.verse: Let all his descendants die and be forgotten by those who live after him.

14.verse: LORD, remember how wicked his ancestors were, and don’t let the sins of his mother be wiped out.

15.verse: LORD, always remember their sins. Then make people forget about them completely.

16.verse: “He did not remember to be loving. He hurt the poor, the needy, and those who were sad until they were nearly dead.

17.verse: He loved to put curses on others, so let those same curses fall on him. He did not like to bless others, so do not let good things happen to him.

18.verse: He cursed others as often as he wore clothes. Cursing others filled his body and his life, like drinking water and using olive oil.

19.verse: So let curses cover him like clothes and wrap around him like a belt.”

20.verse: May the LORD do these things to those who accuse me, to those who speak evil against me.

21.verse: But you, Lord GOD, be kind to me so others will know you are good. Because your love is good, save me.

22.verse: I am poor and helpless and very sad.

23.verse: I am dying like an evening shadow; I am shaken off like a locust.

24.verse: My knees are weak from fasting, and I have grown thin.

25.verse: My enemies insult me; they look at me and shake their heads.

26.verse: LORD my God, help me; because you are loving, save me.

27.verse: Then they will know that your power has done this; they will know that you have done it, LORD.

28.verse: They may curse me, but you bless me. They may attack me, but they will be disgraced. Then I, your servant, will be glad.

29.verse: Let those who accuse me be disgraced and covered with shame like a coat.

30.verse: I will thank the LORD very much; I will praise him in front of many people.

31.verse: He defends the helpless and saves them from those who accuse them.

1.verse: The Lord Appoints a King - A psalm of David. The LORD said to my Lord, “Sit by me at my right side until I put your enemies under your control.”

2.verse: The LORD will enlarge your kingdom beyond Jerusalem, and you will rule over your enemies.

3.verse: Your people will join you on your day of battle. You have been dressed in holiness from birth; you have the freshness of a child.

4.verse: The LORD has made a promise and will not change his mind. He said, “You are a priest forever, a priest like Melchizedek.”

5.verse: The Lord is beside you to help you. When he becomes angry, he will crush kings.

6.verse: He will judge those nations, filling them with dead bodies; he will defeat rulers all over the world.

7.verse: The king will drink from the brook on the way. Then he will be strengthened.

1.verse: Praise the LORD’s Goodness - Praise the LORD! I will thank the LORD with all my heart in the meeting of his good people.

2.verse: The LORD does great things; those who enjoy them seek them.

3.verse: What he does is glorious and splendid, and his goodness continues forever.

4.verse: His miracles are unforgettable. The LORD is kind and merciful.

5.verse: He gives food to those who fear him. He remembers his agreement forever.

6.verse: He has shown his people his power when he gave them the lands of other nations.

7.verse: Everything he does is good and fair; all his orders can be trusted.

8.verse: They will continue forever. They were made true and right.

9.verse: He sets his people free. He made his agreement everlasting. He is holy and wonderful.

10.verse: Wisdom begins with respect for the LORD; those who obey his orders have good understanding. He should be praised forever.

1.verse: Honest People Are Blessed - Praise the LORD! Happy are those who respect the LORD, who want what he commands.

2.verse: Their descendants will be powerful in the land; the children of honest people will be blessed.

3.verse: Their houses will be full of wealth and riches, and their goodness will continue forever.

4.verse: A light shines in the dark for honest people, for those who are merciful and kind and good.

5.verse: It is good to be merciful and generous. Those who are fair in their business

6.verse: will never be defeated. Good people will always be remembered.

7.verse: They won’t be afraid of bad news; their hearts are steady because they trust the LORD.

8.verse: They are confident and will not be afraid; they will look down on their enemies.

9.verse: They give freely to the poor. The things they do are right and will continue forever. They will be given great honor.

10.verse: The wicked will see this and become angry; they will grind their teeth in anger and then disappear. The wishes of the wicked will come to nothing.

1.verse: Praise for the Lord’s Kindness - Praise the LORD! Praise him, you servants of the LORD; praise the name of the LORD.

2.verse: The LORD’s name should be praised now and forever.

3.verse: The LORD’s name should be praised from where the sun rises to where it sets.

4.verse: The LORD is supreme over all the nations; his glory reaches to the skies.

5.verse: No one is like the LORD our God, who rules from heaven,

6.verse: who bends down to look at the skies and the earth.

7.verse: The LORD lifts the poor from the dirt and takes the helpless from the ashes.

8.verse: He seats them with princes, the princes of his people.

9.verse: He gives children to the woman who has none and makes her a happy mother. Praise the LORD!

1.verse: God Brought Israel from Egypt - When the Israelites went out of Egypt, the people of Jacob left that foreign country.

2.verse: Then Judah became God’s holy place; Israel became the land he ruled.

3.verse: The Red Sea looked and ran away; the Jordan River turned back.

4.verse: The mountains danced like sheep and the hills like little lambs.

5.verse: Sea, why did you run away? Jordan, why did you turn back?

6.verse: Mountains, why did you dance like sheep? Hills, why did you dance like little lambs?

7.verse: Earth, shake with fear before the Lord, before the God of Jacob.

8.verse: He turned a rock into a pool of water, a hard rock into a spring of water.

1.verse: The One True God - It does not belong to us, LORD. The glory belongs to you because of your love and loyalty.

2.verse: Why do the nations ask, “Where is their God?”

3.verse: Our God is in heaven. He does what he pleases.

4.verse: Their idols are made of silver and gold, the work of human hands.

5.verse: They have mouths, but they cannot speak. They have eyes, but they cannot see.

6.verse: They have ears, but they cannot hear. They have noses, but they cannot smell.

7.verse: They have hands, but they cannot feel. They have feet, but they cannot walk. No sounds come from their throats.

8.verse: People who make idols will be like them, and so will those who trust them.

9.verse: Family of Israel, trust the LORD; he is your helper and your protection.

10.verse: Family of Aaron, trust the LORD; he is your helper and your protection.

11.verse: You who respect the LORD should trust him; he is your helper and your protection.

12.verse: The LORD remembers us and will bless us. He will bless the family of Israel; he will bless the family of Aaron.

13.verse: The LORD will bless those who respect him, from the smallest to the greatest.

14.verse: May the LORD give you success, and may he give you and your children success.

15.verse: May you be blessed by the LORD, who made heaven and earth.

16.verse: Heaven belongs to the LORD, but he gave the earth to people.

17.verse: Dead people do not praise the LORD; those in the grave are silent.

18.verse: But we will praise the LORD now and forever. Praise the LORD!

1.verse: Thanksgiving for Escaping Death - I love the LORD, because he listens to my prayers for help.

2.verse: He paid attention to me, so I will call to him for help as long as I live.

3.verse: The ropes of death bound me, and the fear of the grave took hold of me. I was troubled and sad.

4.verse: Then I called out the name of the LORD. I said, “Please, LORD, save me!”

5.verse: The LORD is kind and does what is right; our God is merciful.

6.verse: The LORD watches over the foolish; when I was helpless, he saved me.

7.verse: I said to myself, “Relax, because the LORD takes care of you.”

8.verse: LORD, you saved me from death. You stopped my eyes from crying; you kept me from being defeated.

9.verse: So I will walk with the LORD in the land of the living.

10.verse: I believed, so I said, “I am completely ruined.”

11.verse: In my distress I said, “All people are liars.”

12.verse: What can I give the LORD for all the good things he has given to me?

13.verse: I will lift up the cup of salvation, and I will pray to the LORD.

14.verse: I will give the LORD what I promised in front of all his people.

15.verse: The death of one that belongs to the LORD is precious in his sight.

16.verse: LORD, I am your servant; I am your servant and the son of your female servant. You have freed me from my chains.

17.verse: I will give you an offering to show thanks to you, and I will pray to the LORD.

18.verse: I will give the LORD what I promised in front of all his people,

19.verse: in the Temple courtyards in Jerusalem. Praise the LORD!

1.verse: A Hymn of Praise - All you nations, praise the LORD. All you people, praise him

2.verse: because the LORD loves us very much, and his truth is everlasting. Praise the LORD!

1.verse: Thanksgiving for Victory - Thank the LORD because he is good. His love continues forever.

2.verse: Let the people of Israel say, “His love continues forever.”

3.verse: Let the family of Aaron say, “His love continues forever.”

4.verse: Let those who respect the LORD say, “His love continues forever.”

5.verse: I was in trouble, so I called to the LORD. The LORD answered me and set me free.

6.verse: I will not be afraid, because the LORD is with me. People can’t do anything to me.

7.verse: The LORD is with me to help me, so I will see my enemies defeated.

8.verse: It is better to trust the LORD than to trust people.

9.verse: It is better to trust the LORD than to trust princes.

10.verse: All the nations surrounded me, but I defeated them in the name of the LORD.

11.verse: They surrounded me on every side, but with the LORD’s power I defeated them.

12.verse: They surrounded me like a swarm of bees, but they died as quickly as thorns burn. By the LORD’s power, I defeated them.

13.verse: They chased me until I was almost defeated, but the LORD helped me.

14.verse: The LORD gives me strength and a song. He has saved me.

15.verse: Shouts of joy and victory come from the tents of those who do right: “The LORD has done powerful things.”

16.verse: The power of the LORD has won the victory; with his power the LORD has done mighty things.

17.verse: I will not die, but live, and I will tell what the LORD has done.

18.verse: The LORD has taught me a hard lesson, but he did not let me die.

19.verse: Open for me the Temple gates. Then I will come in and thank the LORD.

20.verse: This is the LORD’s gate; only those who are good may enter through it.

21.verse: LORD, I thank you for answering me. You have saved me.

22.verse: The stone that the builders rejected became the cornerstone.

23.verse: The LORD did this, and it is wonderful to us.

24.verse: This is the day that the LORD has made. Let us rejoice and be glad today!

25.verse: Please, LORD, save us; please, LORD, give us success.

26.verse: God bless the one who comes in the name of the LORD. We bless all of you from the Temple of the LORD.

27.verse: The LORD is God, and he has shown kindness to us. With branches in your hands, join the feast. Come to the corners of the altar.

28.verse: You are my God, and I will thank you; you are my God, and I will praise your greatness.

29.verse: Thank the LORD because he is good. His love continues forever.

1.verse: The Word of God - Happy are those who live pure lives, who follow the LORD’s teachings.

2.verse: Happy are those who keep his rules, who try to obey him with their whole heart.

3.verse: They don’t do what is wrong; they follow his ways.

4.verse: LORD, you gave your orders to be obeyed completely.

5.verse: I wish I were more loyal in obeying your demands.

6.verse: Then I would not be ashamed when I study your commands.

7.verse: When I learned that your laws are fair, I praised you with an honest heart.

8.verse: I will obey your demands, so please don’t ever leave me.

9.verse: How can a young person live a pure life? By obeying your word.

10.verse: With all my heart I try to obey you. Don’t let me break your commands.

11.verse: I have taken your words to heart so I would not sin against you.

12.verse: LORD, you should be praised. Teach me your demands.

13.verse: My lips will tell about all the laws you have spoken.

14.verse: I enjoy living by your rules as people enjoy great riches.

15.verse: I think about your orders and study your ways.

16.verse: I enjoy obeying your demands, and I will not forget your word.

17.verse: Do good to me, your servant, so I can live, so I can obey your word.

18.verse: Open my eyes to see the miracles in your teachings.

19.verse: I am a stranger on earth. Do not hide your commands from me.

20.verse: I wear myself out with desire for your laws all the time.

21.verse: You scold proud people; those who ignore your commands are cursed.

22.verse: Don’t let me be insulted and hated because I keep your rules.

23.verse: Even if princes speak against me, I, your servant, will think about your demands.

24.verse: Your rules give me pleasure; they give me good advice.

25.verse: I am about to die. Give me life, as you have promised.

26.verse: I told you about my life, and you answered me. Teach me your demands.

27.verse: Help me understand your orders. Then I will think about your miracles.

28.verse: I am sad and tired. Make me strong again as you have promised.

29.verse: Don’t let me be dishonest; have mercy on me by helping me obey your teachings.

30.verse: I have chosen the way of truth; I have obeyed your laws.

31.verse: I hold on to your rules. LORD, do not let me be disgraced.

32.verse: I will quickly obey your commands, because you have made me happy.

33.verse: LORD, teach me your demands, and I will keep them until the end.

34.verse: Help me understand, so I can keep your teachings, obeying them with all my heart.

35.verse: Lead me in the path of your commands, because that makes me happy.

36.verse: Make me want to keep your rules instead of wishing for riches.

37.verse: Keep me from looking at worthless things. Let me live by your word.

38.verse: Keep your promise to me, your servant, so you will be respected.

39.verse: Take away the shame I fear, because your laws are good.

40.verse: How I want to follow your orders. Give me life because of your goodness.

41.verse: LORD, show me your love, and save me as you have promised.

42.verse: I have an answer for people who insult me, because I trust what you say.

43.verse: Never keep me from speaking your truth, because I depend on your fair laws.

44.verse: I will obey your teachings forever and ever.

45.verse: So I will live in freedom, because I want to follow your orders.

46.verse: I will discuss your rules with kings and will not be ashamed.

47.verse: I enjoy obeying your commands, which I love.

48.verse: I praise your commands, which I love, and I think about your demands.

49.verse: Remember your promise to me, your servant; it gives me hope.

50.verse: When I suffer, this comforts me: Your promise gives me life.

51.verse: Proud people always make fun of me, but I do not reject your teachings.

52.verse: I remember your laws from long ago, and they comfort me, LORD.

53.verse: I become angry with wicked people who do not keep your teachings.

54.verse: I sing about your demands wherever I live.

55.verse: LORD, I remember you at night, and I will obey your teachings.

56.verse: This is what I do: I follow your orders.

57.verse: LORD, you are my share in life; I have promised to obey your words.

58.verse: I prayed to you with all my heart. Have mercy on me as you have promised.

59.verse: I thought about my life, and I decided to follow your rules.

60.verse: I hurried and did not wait to obey your commands.

61.verse: Wicked people have tied me up, but I have not forgotten your teachings.

62.verse: In the middle of the night, I get up to thank you because your laws are right.

63.verse: I am a friend to everyone who fears you, to anyone who obeys your orders.

64.verse: LORD, your love fills the earth. Teach me your demands.

65.verse: You have done good things for your servant, as you have promised, LORD.

66.verse: Teach me wisdom and knowledge because I trust your commands.

67.verse: Before I suffered, I did wrong, but now I obey your word.

68.verse: You are good, and you do what is good. Teach me your demands.

69.verse: Proud people have made up lies about me, but I will follow your orders with all my heart.

70.verse: Those people have no feelings, but I love your teachings.

71.verse: It was good for me to suffer so I would learn your demands.

72.verse: Your teachings are worth more to me than thousands of pieces of gold and silver.

73.verse: You made me and formed me with your hands. Give me understanding so I can learn your commands.

74.verse: Let those who respect you rejoice when they see me, because I put my hope in your word.

75.verse: LORD, I know that your laws are right and that it was right for you to punish me.

76.verse: Comfort me with your love, as you promised me, your servant.

77.verse: Have mercy on me so that I may live. I love your teachings.

78.verse: Make proud people ashamed because they lied about me. But I will think about your orders.

79.verse: Let those who respect you return to me, those who know your rules.

80.verse: Let me obey your demands perfectly so I will not be ashamed.

81.verse: I am weak from waiting for you to save me, but I hope in your word.

82.verse: My eyes are tired from looking for your promise. When will you comfort me?

83.verse: Even though I am like a wine bag going up in smoke, I do not forget your demands.

84.verse: How long will I live? When will you judge those who are hurting me?

85.verse: Proud people have dug pits to trap me. They have nothing to do with your teachings.

86.verse: All of your commands can be trusted. Liars are hurting me. Help me!

87.verse: They have almost put me in the grave, but I have not rejected your orders.

88.verse: Give me life by your love so I can obey your rules.

89.verse: LORD, your word is everlasting; it continues forever in heaven.

90.verse: Your loyalty will go on and on; you made the earth, and it still stands.

91.verse: All things continue to this day because of your laws, because all things serve you.

92.verse: If I had not loved your teachings, I would have died from my sufferings.

93.verse: I will never forget your orders, because you have given me life by them.

94.verse: I am yours. Save me. I want to obey your orders.

95.verse: Wicked people are waiting to destroy me, but I will think about your rules.

96.verse: Everything I see has its limits, but your commands have none.

97.verse: How I love your teachings! I think about them all day long.

98.verse: Your commands make me wiser than my enemies, because they are mine forever.

99.verse: I am wiser than all my teachers, because I think about your rules.

100.verse: I have more understanding than the elders, because I follow your orders.

101.verse: I have avoided every evil way so I could obey your word.

102.verse: I haven’t walked away from your laws, because you yourself are my teacher.

103.verse: Your promises are sweet to me, sweeter than honey in my mouth!

104.verse: Your orders give me understanding, so I hate lying ways.

105.verse: Your word is like a lamp for my feet and a light for my path.

106.verse: I will do what I have promised and obey your fair laws.

107.verse: I have suffered for a long time. LORD, give me life by your word.

108.verse: LORD, accept my willing praise and teach me your laws.

109.verse: My life is always in danger, but I haven’t forgotten your teachings.

110.verse: Wicked people have set a trap for me, but I haven’t strayed from your orders.

111.verse: I will follow your rules forever, because they make me happy.

112.verse: I will try to do what you demand forever, until the end.

113.verse: I hate disloyal people, but I love your teachings.

114.verse: You are my hiding place and my shield; I hope in your word.

115.verse: Get away from me, you who do evil, so I can keep my God’s commands.

116.verse: Support me as you promised so I can live. Don’t let me be embarrassed because of my hopes.

117.verse: Help me, and I will be saved. I will always respect your demands.

118.verse: You reject those who ignore your demands, because their lies mislead them.

119.verse: You throw away the wicked of the world like trash. So I will love your rules.

120.verse: I shake in fear of you; I respect your laws.

121.verse: I have done what is fair and right. Don’t leave me to those who wrong me.

122.verse: Promise that you will help me, your servant. Don’t let proud people wrong me.

123.verse: My eyes are tired from looking for your salvation and for your good promise.

124.verse: Show your love to me, your servant, and teach me your demands.

125.verse: I am your servant. Give me wisdom so I can understand your rules.

126.verse: LORD, it is time for you to do something, because people have disobeyed your teachings.

127.verse: I love your commands more than the purest gold.

128.verse: I respect all your orders, so I hate lying ways.

129.verse: Your rules are wonderful. That is why I keep them.

130.verse: Learning your words gives wisdom and understanding for the foolish.

131.verse: I am nearly out of breath. I really want to learn your commands.

132.verse: Look at me and have mercy on me as you do for those who love you.

133.verse: Guide my steps as you promised; don’t let any sin control me.

134.verse: Save me from harmful people so I can obey your orders.

135.verse: Show your kindness to me, your servant. Teach me your demands.

136.verse: Tears stream from my eyes, because people do not obey your teachings.

137.verse: LORD, you do what is right, and your laws are fair.

138.verse: The rules you commanded are right and completely trustworthy.

139.verse: I am so upset I am worn out, because my enemies have forgotten your words.

140.verse: Your promises are proven, so I, your servant, love them.

141.verse: I am unimportant and hated, but I have not forgotten your orders.

142.verse: Your goodness continues forever, and your teachings are true.

143.verse: I have had troubles and misery, but I love your commands.

144.verse: Your rules are always good. Help me understand so I can live.

145.verse: LORD, I call to you with all my heart. Answer me, and I will keep your demands.

146.verse: I call to you. Save me so I can obey your rules.

147.verse: I wake up early in the morning and cry out. I hope in your word.

148.verse: I stay awake all night so I can think about your promises.

149.verse: Listen to me because of your love; LORD, give me life by your laws.

150.verse: Those who love evil are near, but they are far from your teachings.

151.verse: But, LORD, you are also near, and all your commands are true.

152.verse: Long ago I learned from your rules that you made them to continue forever.

153.verse: See my suffering and rescue me, because I have not forgotten your teachings.

154.verse: Argue my case and save me. Let me live by your promises.

155.verse: Wicked people are far from being saved, because they do not want your demands.

156.verse: LORD, you are very kind; give me life by your laws.

157.verse: Many enemies are after me, but I have not rejected your rules.

158.verse: I see those traitors, and I hate them, because they do not obey what you say.

159.verse: See how I love your orders. LORD, give me life by your love.

160.verse: Your words are true from the start, and all your laws will be fair forever.

161.verse: Leaders attack me for no reason, but I fear your law in my heart.

162.verse: I am as happy over your promises as if I had found a great treasure.

163.verse: I hate and despise lies, but I love your teachings.

164.verse: Seven times a day I praise you for your fair laws.

165.verse: Those who love your teachings will find true peace, and nothing will defeat them.

166.verse: I am waiting for you to save me, LORD. I will obey your commands.

167.verse: I obey your rules, and I love them very much.

168.verse: I obey your orders and rules, because you know everything I do.

169.verse: Hear my cry to you, LORD. Let your word help me understand.

170.verse: Listen to my prayer; save me as you promised.

171.verse: Let me speak your praise, because you have taught me your demands.

172.verse: Let me sing about your promises, because all your commands are fair.

173.verse: Give me your helping hand, because I have chosen your commands.

174.verse: I want you to save me, LORD. I love your teachings.

175.verse: Let me live so I can praise you, and let your laws help me.

176.verse: I have wandered like a lost sheep. Look for your servant, because I have not forgotten your commands.

1.verse: A Prayer of Someone Far from Home - A psalm for going up to worship. When I was in trouble, I called to the LORD, and he answered me.

2.verse: LORD, save me from liars and from those who plan evil.

3.verse: You who plan evil, what will God do to you? How will he punish you?

4.verse: He will punish you with the sharp arrows of a warrior and with burning coals of wood.

5.verse: How terrible it is for me to live in the land of Meshech, to live among the people of Kedar.

6.verse: I have lived too long with people who hate peace.

7.verse: When I talk peace, they want war.

1.verse: The Lord Guards His People - A song for going up to worship. I look up to the hills, but where does my help come from?

2.verse: My help comes from the LORD, who made heaven and earth.

3.verse: He will not let you be defeated. He who guards you never sleeps.

4.verse: He who guards Israel never rests or sleeps.

5.verse: The LORD guards you. The LORD is the shade that protects you from the sun.

6.verse: The sun cannot hurt you during the day, and the moon cannot hurt you at night.

7.verse: The LORD will protect you from all dangers; he will guard your life.

8.verse: The LORD will guard you as you come and go, both now and forever.

1.verse: Happy People in Jerusalem - A song for going up to worship. Of David. I was happy when they said to me, “Let’s go to the Temple of the LORD.”

2.verse: Jerusalem, we are standing at your gates.

3.verse: Jerusalem is built as a city with the buildings close together.

4.verse: The tribes go up there, the tribes who belong to the LORD. It is the rule in Israel to praise the LORD at Jerusalem.

5.verse: There the descendants of David set their thrones to judge the people.

6.verse: Pray for peace in Jerusalem: “May those who love her be safe.

7.verse: May there be peace within her walls and safety within her strong towers.”

8.verse: To help my relatives and friends, I say, “Let Jerusalem have peace.”

9.verse: For the sake of the Temple of the LORD our God, I wish good for her.

1.verse: A Prayer for Mercy - A song for going up to worship. LORD, I look upward to you, you who live in heaven.

2.verse: Slaves depend on their masters, and a female servant depends on her mistress. In the same way, we depend on the LORD our God; we wait for him to show us mercy.

3.verse: Have mercy on us, LORD. Have mercy on us, because we have been insulted.

4.verse: We have suffered many insults from lazy people and much cruelty from the proud.

1.verse: The Lord Saves His People - A song for going up to worship. Of David. What if the LORD had not been on our side? (Let Israel repeat this.)

2.verse: What if the LORD had not been on our side when we were attacked?

3.verse: When they were angry with us, they would have swallowed us alive.

4.verse: They would have been like a flood drowning us; they would have poured over us like a river.

5.verse: They would have swept us away like a mighty stream.

6.verse: Praise the LORD, who did not let them chew us up.

7.verse: We escaped like a bird from the hunter’s trap. The trap broke, and we escaped.

8.verse: Our help comes from the LORD, who made heaven and earth.

1.verse: God Protects Those Who Trust Him - A song for going up to worship. Those who trust the LORD are like Mount Zion, which sits unmoved forever.

2.verse: As the mountains surround Jerusalem, the LORD surrounds his people now and forever.

3.verse: The wicked will not rule over those who do right. If they did, the people who do right might use their power to do evil.

4.verse: LORD, be good to those who are good, whose hearts are honest.

5.verse: But, LORD, when you remove those who do evil, also remove those who stop following you. Let there be peace in Israel.

1.verse: Lord, Bring Your People Back - A song for going up to worship. When the LORD brought the prisoners back to Jerusalem, it seemed as if we were dreaming.

2.verse: Then we were filled with laughter, and we sang happy songs. Then the other nations said, “The LORD has done great things for them.”

3.verse: The LORD has done great things for us, and we are very glad.

4.verse: LORD, return our prisoners again, as you bring streams to the desert.

5.verse: Those who cry as they plant crops will sing at harvest time.

6.verse: Those who cry as they carry out the seeds will return singing and carrying bundles of grain.

1.verse: All Good Things Come from God - A song for going up to worship. Of Solomon. If the LORD doesn’t build the house, the builders are working for nothing. If the LORD doesn’t guard the city, the guards are watching for nothing.

2.verse: It is no use for you to get up early and stay up late, working for a living. The LORD gives sleep to those he loves.

3.verse: Children are a gift from the LORD; babies are a reward.

4.verse: Children who are born to a young man are like arrows in the hand of a warrior.

5.verse: Happy is the man who has his bag full of arrows. They will not be defeated when they fight their enemies at the city gate.

1.verse: The Happy Home - A song for going up to worship. Happy are those who respect the LORD and obey him.

2.verse: You will enjoy what you work for, and you will be blessed with good things.

3.verse: Your wife will give you many children, like a vine that produces much fruit. Your children will bring you much good, like olive branches that produce many olives.

4.verse: This is how the man who respects the LORD will be blessed.

5.verse: May the LORD bless you from Mount Zion; may you enjoy the good things of Jerusalem all your life.

6.verse: May you see your grandchildren. Let there be peace in Israel.

1.verse: A Prayer Against the Enemies - A song for going up to worship. They have treated me badly all my life. (Let Israel repeat this.)

2.verse: They have treated me badly all my life, but they have not defeated me.

3.verse: Like farmers plowing, they plowed over my back, making long wounds.

4.verse: But the LORD does what is right; he has set me free from those wicked people.

5.verse: Let those who hate Jerusalem be turned back in shame.

6.verse: Let them be like the grass on the roof that dries up before it has grown.

7.verse: There is not enough of it to fill a hand or to make into a bundle to fill one’s arms.

8.verse: Let those who pass by them not say, “May the LORD bless you. We bless you by the power of the LORD.”

1.verse: A Prayer for Mercy - A song for going up to worship. LORD, I am in great trouble, so I call out to you.

2.verse: Lord, hear my voice; listen to my prayer for help.

3.verse: LORD, if you punished people for all their sins, no one would be left, Lord.

4.verse: But you forgive us, so you are respected.

5.verse: I wait for the LORD to help me, and I trust his word.

6.verse: I wait for the Lord to help me more than night watchmen wait for the dawn, more than night watchmen wait for the dawn.

7.verse: People of Israel, put your hope in the LORD because he is loving and able to save.

8.verse: He will save Israel from all their sins.

1.verse: Childlike Trust in the Lord - A song for going up to worship. Of David. LORD, my heart is not proud; I don’t look down on others. I don’t do great things, and I can’t do miracles.

2.verse: But I am calm and quiet, like a baby with its mother. I am at peace, like a baby with its mother.

3.verse: People of Israel, put your hope in the LORD now and forever.

1.verse: In Praise of the Temple - A song for going up to worship. LORD, remember David and all his suffering.

2.verse: He made an oath to the LORD, a promise to the Mighty God of Jacob.

3.verse: He said, “I will not go home to my house, or lie down on my bed,

4.verse: or close my eyes, or let myself sleep

5.verse: until I find a place for the LORD. I want to provide a home for the Mighty God of Jacob.”

6.verse: We heard about the Ark in Bethlehem. We found it at Kiriath Jearim.

7.verse: Let’s go to the LORD’s house. Let’s worship at his footstool.

8.verse: Rise, LORD, and come to your resting place; come with the Ark that shows your strength.

9.verse: May your priests do what is right. May your people sing for joy.

10.verse: For the sake of your servant David, do not reject your appointed king.

11.verse: The LORD made a promise to David, a sure promise that he will not take back. He promised, “I will make one of your descendants rule as king after you.

12.verse: If your sons keep my agreement and the rules that I teach them, then their sons after them will rule on your throne forever and ever.”

13.verse: The LORD has chosen Jerusalem; he wants it for his home.

14.verse: He says, “This is my resting place forever. Here is where I want to stay.

15.verse: I will bless her with plenty; I will fill her poor with food.

16.verse: I will cover her priests with salvation, and those who worship me will really sing for joy.

17.verse: “I will make a king come from the family of David. I will provide my appointed one descendants to rule after him.

18.verse: I will cover his enemies with shame, but his crown will shine.”

1.verse: The Love of God’s People - A song for going up to worship. Of David. It is good and pleasant when God’s people live together in peace!

2.verse: It is like perfumed oil poured on the priest’s head and running down his beard. It ran down Aaron’s beard and on to the collar of his robes.

3.verse: It is like the dew of Mount Hermon falling on the hills of Jerusalem. There the LORD gives his blessing of life forever.

1.verse: Temple Guards, Praise the Lord - A song for going up to worship. Praise the LORD, all you servants of the LORD, you who serve at night in the Temple of the LORD.

2.verse: Raise your hands in the Temple and praise the LORD.

3.verse: May the LORD bless you from Mount Zion, he who made heaven and earth.

1.verse: The Lord Saves, Idols Do Not - Praise the LORD! Praise the name of the LORD; praise him, you servants of the LORD,

2.verse: you who stand in the LORD’s Temple and in the Temple courtyards.

3.verse: Praise the LORD, because he is good; sing praises to him, because it is pleasant.

4.verse: The LORD has chosen the people of Jacob for himself; he has chosen the people of Israel for his very own.

5.verse: I know that the LORD is great. Our Lord is greater than all the gods.

6.verse: The LORD does what he pleases, in heaven and on earth, in the seas and the deep oceans.

7.verse: He brings the clouds from the ends of the earth. He sends the lightning with the rain. He brings out the wind from his storehouses.

8.verse: He destroyed the firstborn sons in Egypt the firstborn of both people and animals.

9.verse: He did many signs and miracles in Egypt against the king and his servants.

10.verse: He defeated many nations and killed powerful kings:

11.verse: Sihon king of the Amorites, Og king of Bashan, and all the kings of Canaan.

12.verse: Then he gave their land as a gift, a gift to his people, the Israelites.

13.verse: LORD, your name is everlasting; LORD, you will be remembered forever.

14.verse: The LORD defends his people and has mercy on his servants.

15.verse: The idols of other nations are made of silver and gold, the work of human hands.

16.verse: They have mouths, but they cannot speak. They have eyes, but they cannot see.

17.verse: They have ears, but they cannot hear. They have no breath in their mouths.

18.verse: People who make idols will be like them, and so will those who trust them.

19.verse: Family of Israel, praise the LORD. Family of Aaron, praise the LORD.

20.verse: Family of Levi, praise the LORD. You who respect the LORD should praise him.

21.verse: You people of Jerusalem, praise the LORD on Mount Zion. Praise the LORD!

1.verse: God’s Love Continues Forever - Give thanks to the LORD because he is good. His love continues forever.

2.verse: Give thanks to the God of gods. His love continues forever.

3.verse: Give thanks to the Lord of lords. His love continues forever.

4.verse: Only he can do great miracles. His love continues forever.

5.verse: With his wisdom he made the skies. His love continues forever.

6.verse: He spread out the earth on the seas. His love continues forever.

7.verse: He made the sun and the moon. His love continues forever.

8.verse: He made the sun to rule the day. His love continues forever.

9.verse: He made the moon and stars to rule the night. His love continues forever.

10.verse: He killed the firstborn sons of the Egyptians. His love continues forever.

11.verse: He brought the people of Israel out of Egypt. His love continues forever.

12.verse: He did it with his great power and strength. His love continues forever.

13.verse: He parted the water of the Red Sea. His love continues forever.

14.verse: He brought the Israelites through the middle of it. His love continues forever.

15.verse: But the king of Egypt and his army drowned in the Red Sea. His love continues forever.

16.verse: He led his people through the desert. His love continues forever.

17.verse: He defeated great kings. His love continues forever.

18.verse: He killed powerful kings. His love continues forever.

19.verse: He defeated Sihon king of the Amorites. His love continues forever.

20.verse: He defeated Og king of Bashan. His love continues forever.

21.verse: He gave their land as a gift. His love continues forever.

22.verse: It was a gift to his servants, the Israelites. His love continues forever.

23.verse: He remembered us when we were in trouble. His love continues forever.

24.verse: He freed us from our enemies. His love continues forever.

25.verse: He gives food to every living creature. His love continues forever.

26.verse: Give thanks to the God of heaven. His love continues forever.

1.verse: Israelites in Captivity - By the rivers in Babylon we sat and cried when we remembered Jerusalem.

2.verse: On the poplar trees nearby we hung our harps.

3.verse: Those who captured us asked us to sing; our enemies wanted happy songs. They said, “Sing us a song about Jerusalem!”

4.verse: But we cannot sing songs about the LORD while we are in this foreign country!

5.verse: Jerusalem, if I forget you, let my right hand lose its skill.

6.verse: Let my tongue stick to the roof of my mouth if I do not remember you, if I do not think about Jerusalem as my greatest joy.

7.verse: LORD, remember what the Edomites did on the day Jerusalem fell. They said, “Tear it down! Tear it down to its foundations!”

8.verse: People of Babylon, you will be destroyed. The people who pay you back for what you did to us will be happy.

9.verse: They will grab your babies and throw them against the rocks.

1.verse: A Hymn of Thanksgiving - A psalm of David. LORD, I will thank you with all my heart; I will sing to you before the gods.

2.verse: I will bow down facing your holy Temple, and I will thank you for your love and loyalty. You have made your name and your word greater than anything.

3.verse: On the day I called to you, you answered me. You made me strong and brave.

4.verse: LORD, let all the kings of the earth praise you when they hear the words you speak.

5.verse: They will sing about what the LORD has done, because the LORD’s glory is great.

6.verse: Though the LORD is supreme, he takes care of those who are humble, but he stays away from the proud.

7.verse: LORD, even when I have trouble all around me, you will keep me alive. When my enemies are angry, you will reach down and save me by your power.

8.verse: LORD, you do everything for me. LORD, your love continues forever. Do not leave us, whom you made.

1.verse: God Knows Everything - For the director of music. A psalm of David. LORD, you have examined me and know all about me.

2.verse: You know when I sit down and when I get up. You know my thoughts before I think them.

3.verse: You know where I go and where I lie down. You know everything I do.

4.verse: LORD, even before I say a word, you already know it.

5.verse: You are all around me—in front and in back— and have put your hand on me.

6.verse: Your knowledge is amazing to me; it is more than I can understand.

7.verse: Where can I go to get away from your Spirit? Where can I run from you?

8.verse: If I go up to the heavens, you are there. If I lie down in the grave, you are there.

9.verse: If I rise with the sun in the east and settle in the west beyond the sea,

10.verse: even there you would guide me. With your right hand you would hold me.

11.verse: I could say, “The darkness will hide me. Let the light around me turn into night.”

12.verse: But even the darkness is not dark to you. The night is as light as the day; darkness and light are the same to you.

13.verse: You made my whole being; you formed me in my mother’s body.

14.verse: I praise you because you made me in an amazing and wonderful way. What you have done is wonderful. I know this very well.

15.verse: You saw my bones being formed as I took shape in my mother’s body. When I was put together there,

16.verse: you saw my body as it was formed. All the days planned for me were written in your book before I was one day old.

17.verse: God, your thoughts are precious to me. They are so many!

18.verse: If I could count them, they would be more than all the grains of sand. When I wake up, I am still with you.

19.verse: God, I wish you would kill the wicked! Get away from me, you murderers!

20.verse: They say evil things about you. Your enemies use your name thoughtlessly.

21.verse: LORD, I hate those who hate you; I hate those who rise up against you.

22.verse: I feel only hate for them; they are my enemies.

23.verse: God, examine me and know my heart; test me and know my anxious thoughts.

24.verse: See if there is any bad thing in me. Lead me on the road to everlasting life.

1.verse: A Prayer for Protection - For the director of music. A psalm of David. LORD, rescue me from evil people; protect me from cruel people

2.verse: who make evil plans, who always start fights.

3.verse: They make their tongues sharp as a snake’s; their words are like snake poison. Selah

4.verse: LORD, guard me from the power of wicked people; protect me from cruel people who plan to trip me up.

5.verse: The proud hid a trap for me. They spread out a net beside the road; they set traps for me. Selah

6.verse: I said to the LORD, “You are my God.” LORD, listen to my prayer for help.

7.verse: LORD God, my mighty savior, you protect me in battle.

8.verse: LORD, do not give the wicked what they want. Don’t let their plans succeed, or they will become proud. Selah

9.verse: Those around me have planned trouble. Now let it come to them.

10.verse: Let burning coals fall on them. Throw them into the fire or into pits from which they cannot escape.

11.verse: Don’t let liars settle in the land. Let evil quickly hunt down cruel people.

12.verse: I know the LORD will get justice for the poor and will defend the needy in court.

13.verse: Good people will praise his name; honest people will live in his presence.

1.verse: A Prayer Not to Sin - A psalm of David. LORD, I call to you. Come quickly. Listen to me when I call to you.

2.verse: Let my prayer be like incense placed before you, and my praise like the evening sacrifice.

3.verse: LORD, help me control my tongue; help me be careful about what I say.

4.verse: Take away my desire to do evil or to join others in doing wrong. Don’t let me eat tasty food with those who do evil.

5.verse: If a good person punished me, that would be kind. If he corrected me, that would be like perfumed oil on my head. I shouldn’t refuse it. But I pray against those who do evil.

6.verse: Let their leaders be thrown down the cliffs. Then people will know that I have spoken correctly:

7.verse: “The ground is plowed and broken up. In the same way, our bones have been scattered at the grave.”

8.verse: GOD, I look to you for help. I trust in you, LORD. Don’t let me die.

9.verse: Protect me from the traps they set for me and from the net that evil people have spread.

10.verse: Let the wicked fall into their own nets, but let me pass by safely.

1.verse: A Prayer for Safety - A maskil of David when he was in the cave. A prayer. I cry out to the LORD; I pray to the LORD for mercy.

2.verse: I pour out my problems to him; I tell him my troubles.

3.verse: When I am afraid, you, LORD, know the way out. In the path where I walk, a trap is hidden for me.

4.verse: Look around me and see. No one cares about me. I have no place of safety; no one cares if I live.

5.verse: LORD, I cry out to you. I say, “You are my protection. You are all I want in this life.”

6.verse: Listen to my cry, because I am helpless. Save me from those who are chasing me, because they are too strong for me.

7.verse: Free me from my prison, and then I will praise your name. Then good people will surround me, because you have taken care of me.

1.verse: A Prayer Not to Be Killed - A psalm of David. LORD, hear my prayer; listen to my cry for mercy. Answer me because you are loyal and good.

2.verse: Don’t judge me, your servant, because no one alive is right before you.

3.verse: My enemies are chasing me; they crushed me to the ground. They made me live in darkness like those long dead.

4.verse: I am afraid; my courage is gone.

5.verse: I remember what happened long ago; I consider everything you have done. I think about all you have made.

6.verse: I lift my hands to you in prayer. As a dry land needs rain, I thirst for you. Selah

7.verse: LORD, answer me quickly, because I am getting weak. Don’t turn away from me, or I will be like those who are dead.

8.verse: Tell me in the morning about your love, because I trust you. Show me what I should do, because my prayers go up to you.

9.verse: LORD, save me from my enemies; I hide in you.

10.verse: Teach me to do what you want, because you are my God. Let your good Spirit lead me on level ground.

11.verse: LORD, let me live so people will praise you. In your goodness save me from my troubles.

12.verse: In your love defeat my enemies. Destroy all those who trouble me, because I am your servant.

1.verse: A Prayer for Victory - Of David. Praise the LORD, my Rock, who trains me for war, who trains me for battle.

2.verse: He protects me like a strong, walled city, and he loves me. He is my defender and my Savior, my shield and my protection. He helps me keep my people under control.

3.verse: LORD, why are people important to you? Why do you even think about human beings?

4.verse: People are like a breath; their lives are like passing shadows.

5.verse: LORD, tear open the sky and come down. Touch the mountains so they will smoke.

6.verse: Send the lightning and scatter my enemies. Shoot your arrows and force them away.

7.verse: Reach down from above. Save me and rescue me out of this sea of enemies, from these foreigners.

8.verse: They are liars; they are dishonest.

9.verse: God, I will sing a new song to you; I will play to you on the ten-stringed harp.

10.verse: You give victory to kings. You save your servant David from cruel swords.

11.verse: Save me, rescue me from these foreigners. They are liars; they are dishonest.

12.verse: Let our sons in their youth grow like plants. Let our daughters be like the decorated stones in the Temple.

13.verse: Let our barns be filled with crops of all kinds. Let our sheep in the fields have thousands and tens of thousands of lambs.

14.verse: Let our cattle be strong. Let no one break in. Let there be no war, no screams in our streets.

15.verse: Happy are those who are like this; happy are the people whose God is the LORD.

1.verse: Praise to God the King - A psalm of praise. Of David. I praise your greatness, my God the King; I will praise you forever and ever.

2.verse: I will praise you every day; I will praise you forever and ever.

3.verse: The LORD is great and worthy of our praise; no one can understand how great he is.

4.verse: Parents will tell their children what you have done. They will retell your mighty acts,

5.verse: wonderful majesty, and glory. And I will think about your miracles.

6.verse: They will tell about the amazing things you do, and I will tell how great you are.

7.verse: They will remember your great goodness and will sing about your fairness.

8.verse: The LORD is kind and shows mercy. He does not become angry quickly but is full of love.

9.verse: The LORD is good to everyone; he is merciful to all he has made.

10.verse: LORD, everything you have made will praise you; those who belong to you will bless you.

11.verse: They will tell about the glory of your kingdom and will speak about your power.

12.verse: Then everyone will know the mighty things you do and the glory and majesty of your kingdom.

13.verse: Your kingdom will go on and on, and you will rule forever. The LORD will keep all his promises; he is loyal to all he has made.

14.verse: The LORD helps those who have been defeated and takes care of those who are in trouble.

15.verse: All living things look to you for food, and you give it to them at the right time.

16.verse: You open your hand, and you satisfy all living things.

17.verse: Everything the LORD does is right. He is loyal to all he has made.

18.verse: The LORD is close to everyone who prays to him, to all who truly pray to him.

19.verse: He gives those who respect him what they want. He listens when they cry, and he saves them.

20.verse: The LORD protects everyone who loves him, but he will destroy the wicked.

21.verse: I will praise the LORD. Let everyone praise his holy name forever.

1.verse: Praise God Who Helps the Weak - Praise the LORD! My whole being, praise the LORD.

2.verse: I will praise the LORD all my life; I will sing praises to my God as long as I live.

3.verse: Do not put your trust in princes or other people, who cannot save you.

4.verse: When people die, they are buried. Then all of their plans come to an end.

5.verse: Happy are those who are helped by the God of Jacob. Their hope is in the LORD their God.

6.verse: He made heaven and earth, the sea and everything in it. He remains loyal forever.

7.verse: He does what is fair for those who have been wronged. He gives food to the hungry. The LORD sets the prisoners free.

8.verse: The LORD gives sight to the blind. The LORD lifts up people who are in trouble. The LORD loves those who do right.

9.verse: The LORD protects the foreigners. He defends the orphans and widows, but he blocks the way of the wicked.

10.verse: The LORD will be King forever. Jerusalem, your God is everlasting. Praise the LORD!

1.verse: Praise God Who Helps His People - Praise the LORD! It is good to sing praises to our God; it is good and pleasant to praise him.

2.verse: The LORD rebuilds Jerusalem; he brings back the captured Israelites.

3.verse: He heals the brokenhearted and bandages their wounds.

4.verse: He counts the stars and names each one.

5.verse: Our Lord is great and very powerful. There is no limit to what he knows.

6.verse: The LORD defends the humble, but he throws the wicked to the ground.

7.verse: Sing praises to the LORD; praise our God with harps.

8.verse: He fills the sky with clouds and sends rain to the earth and makes grass grow on the hills.

9.verse: He gives food to cattle and to the little birds that call.

10.verse: He is not impressed with the strength of a horse or with human might.

11.verse: The LORD is pleased with those who respect him, with those who trust his love.

12.verse: Jerusalem, praise the LORD; Jerusalem, praise your God.

13.verse: He makes your city gates strong and blesses your children inside.

14.verse: He brings peace to your country and fills you with the finest grain.

15.verse: He gives a command to the earth, and it quickly obeys him.

16.verse: He spreads the snow like wool and scatters the frost like ashes.

17.verse: He throws down hail like rocks. No one can stand the cold he sends.

18.verse: Then he gives a command, and it melts. He sends the breezes, and the waters flow.

19.verse: He gave his word to Jacob, his laws and demands to Israel.

20.verse: He didn’t do this for any other nation. They don’t know his laws. Praise the LORD!

1.verse: The World Should Praise the LORD - Praise the LORD! Praise the LORD from the skies. Praise him high above the earth.

2.verse: Praise him, all you angels. Praise him, all you armies of heaven.

3.verse: Praise him, sun and moon. Praise him, all you shining stars.

4.verse: Praise him, highest heavens and you waters above the sky.

5.verse: Let them praise the LORD, because they were created by his command.

6.verse: He put them in place forever and ever; he made a law that will never change.

7.verse: Praise the LORD from the earth, you large sea animals and all the oceans,

8.verse: lightning and hail, snow and mist, and stormy winds that obey him,

9.verse: mountains and all hills, fruit trees and all cedars,

10.verse: wild animals and all cattle, crawling animals and birds,

11.verse: kings of the earth and all nations, princes and all rulers of the earth,

12.verse: young men and women, old people and children.

13.verse: Praise the LORD, because he alone is great. He is more wonderful than heaven and earth.

14.verse: God has given his people a king. He should be praised by all who belong to him; he should be praised by the Israelites, the people closest to his heart. Praise the LORD!

1.verse: Praise the God of Israel - Praise the LORD! Sing a new song to the LORD; sing his praise in the meeting of his people.

2.verse: Let the Israelites be happy because of God, their Maker. Let the people of Jerusalem rejoice because of their King.

3.verse: They should praise him with dancing. They should sing praises to him with tambourines and harps.

4.verse: The LORD is pleased with his people; he saves the humble.

5.verse: Let those who worship him rejoice in his glory. Let them sing for joy even in bed!

6.verse: Let them shout his praise with their two-edged swords in their hands.

7.verse: They will punish the nations and defeat the people.

8.verse: They will put those kings in chains and those important men in iron bands.

9.verse: They will punish them as God has written. God is honored by all who worship him. Praise the LORD!

1.verse: Praise the LORD with Music - Praise the LORD! Praise God in his Temple; praise him in his mighty heaven.

2.verse: Praise him for his strength; praise him for his greatness.

3.verse: Praise him with trumpet blasts; praise him with harps and lyres.

4.verse: Praise him with tambourines and dancing; praise him with stringed instruments and flutes.

5.verse: Praise him with loud cymbals; praise him with crashing cymbals.

6.verse: Let everything that breathes praise the LORD. Praise the LORD!
